title: Programmer Analyst - Expert, SourceLink, UMKC Innovation Center, 61047
description:
**Hiring Department**
---------------------

UMKC's Innovation Center; SourceLink

**Job Description**
-------------------

SourceLink is looking for a skilled full-time .NET Developer who has a passion for and experienced in developing web applications. This position will be developing new experiences for our tools, maintaining existing web applications and supporting the end-users who rely on the tools. You will be collaborating within a team setting with other developers, stakeholders, managers, and end-users.

**Responsibilities:**

* Participate in new application development and existing system enhancements (C#)
* Enhance existing internal APIs (.NET Core)
* Maintain existing systems by fixing bugs and addressing inefficiencies
* Create and update reports using SSRS

**Skills and qualities:**

* Experience developing in C# and ASP.NET Core version 2 and up
* Strong JavaScript skills including common frameworks and libraries
* Strong knowledge of Object-Oriented Design and programming
* Strong knowledge of ORMs such as Entity Framework
* Experience working with T-SQL and basic database modeling
* Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services
* Strong debugging skills
* Team player and willing to go the extra mile
* Strong work ethic, quick learner and highly motivated
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbally
* Quick learner with the ability to be productive quickly

**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

A Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience and 4+ years work experience from which comparable knowledge and skills can be acquired is necessary.

Must know electronic computer programming; electronic data processing equipment and its capabilities; principles and techniques of studying work processes for new or revised electronic computer applications; principles of designing methods of processing data; technical report writing; and application of algorithms and mathematical modeling.

Must have the ability to write complex programs and develop detailed program specifications; analyze data and situations, reason logically and creatively, identify problems, draw valid conclusions, and develop effective solutions.

2+ years' experience with C#/.NET or Java

**Anticipated Hiring Range**
----------------------------

$59,738 - $90,000 commensurate with experience, education, and internal equity.

(Please note: While the range begins at $59,738, it is anticipated that this role will pay between $75,000 and $90,000 commensurate with experience, education, and internal equity)

**Application Deadline**
------------------------

Application review begins immediately. Position will remain open until filled.

**Other Information**
---------------------

SourceLink is an ambitious group within UMKC that builds tools to support entrepreneurial ecosystems. Our program was developed through support from the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation, the U.S. Small Business Administration and the University of Missouri-Kansas City in 2003 with a single mission: *make entrepreneurship easier*. Implementations of our program are in many regions across the U.S., and expanding internationally. The web tools we provide to these communities include a responsive website, a web-based resource database search tool, and a client relationship management system.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone to join a small team in building out the next set of product features. You will be working with a fast paced and highly motivated group of programmers and business developers.

**Startup Mindset, Big Firm Benefits**

As a program of UMKC's Innovation Center, you'll work with a small-but-mighty entrepreneurial team while enjoying big firm benefits like:

* Generous vacation package
* Medical, vision, and dental insurance
* Fitness center
* 75% discount on University of Missouri courses
* Defined contribution retirement plan with supplemented 403b, 457b and 401a plans

**Benefit Eligibility**
-----------------------

This position is eligible for University benefits. As part of your total compensation, the University offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental and vision plans, retirement, paid time off, short- and long-term disability, paid parental leave, paid caregiver leave, and educational fee discounts for all four UM System campuses. For additional information on University benefits, please visit the Faculty & Staff Benefits website at https://www.umsystem.edu/totalrewards/benefits.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

The University of Missouri is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  
  
To request ADA accommodations, please call the Office of Equity & Title IX at 816-235-6910.

title: Data Specialist, Business Information
description:
**WHO WE ARE**

A modern and agile company with the most finely meshed international network, Coface is a reference in credit insurance and risk management. With over 70 years of experience as an industry leader, and a team of 4,100 experts in over 65 countries, serving around 50,000 companies, Coface experts work to the beat of the global economy. Its ambition is to become the most agile, global trade credit insurance partner in the industry. We believe in business as a force for good in the world.

**THE ROLE**

We are seeking a **mid-level Data Specialist** with a strong focus on **business data acquisition and Data Quality** to support the expansion of our data assets and improve business decision-making. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing, integrating, and maintaining high-quality business data from both internal systems and external providers. Your work will enable strategic insights for the Business Information products.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Identify and acquire relevant internal and external business data (e.g., sales, customer, partner, financial, third-party market data, Public sources).
* Collaborate with vendors, Information partners, and data providers to manage incoming data and data investigations with SLA’s in place.
* Validate incoming datasets to ensure quality, consistency, and usability. Develop investigation model to manage quality issues.
* Develop and maintain data ingestion pipelines for local data management.
* Monitor data freshness, completeness, and integrity using QA frameworks and data profiling tools.
* Maintain metadata, source documentation, and data lineage tracking.
* Work with business units to understand data sourcing requirements and translate them into acquisition workflows.

* Ensure all data acquisition processes comply with data governance, privacy, and security policies Migration support - Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand requirements, set expectations, and ensure clear communication throughout the migration process.
ICON/URBA champion. Representing the region for new system releases, testing, and training local users.  

**TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS - API:**

*Assessing and executing on the technical needs across various industries with a focus on automating and integrating Product and API’s.*

* + Delivers technical expertise with the sales team to expand use cases for Business Information.
  + Performs customer discovery discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal solutions.
  + Documents, via diagrams and writing, and presents the solution to the customer, describes the benefits of the solution.
  + Builds relationships with customers serving as the technical liaison from pre-sales to post-sales.
  + Follows industry technology trends through self-study and formal training and shares that knowledge with customers.
  Leads internal global cross-functional teams to obtain required approvals of non-standard designs for customers.

  

**THE CANDIDATE**

* Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
* 3–5 years of experience in a data-centric role, with direct involvement in data acquisition or data integration.
* Strong SQL skills and familiarity with APIs, flat files, and batch data transfers.
* Hands-on experience working with business data from CRM, ERP, and financial systems.
* Strong understanding of data quality concepts, cleansing techniques, and validation rules.
* Ability to manage multiple data sources and align them with business needs.
Ability to work US – Remote, Canada – Montreal or Toronto with 25% expected travel.  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Azure, AWS).
* Familiarity with data catalog tools and metadata management.
* Experience working with external data vendors.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
* Customer Analytics
  + Analyze customer demographics, behavior patterns, and financial data to segment customers into distinct groups for targeted outreach efforts, including email, direct mail, digital advertising, calling, and more, based on department or organizational goals and criteria.
  + Conduct market analysis to identify emerging trends, market potential, competitor activity, and customer needs to inform marketing strategy development.
  + Develop predictive models to identify potential customers most likely to respond to specific marketing offers, enabling targeted outreach and lead generation.
* Campaign Support:
  + Help execute A/B testing on marketing campaigns to identify the most effective messaging, landing pages, and call-to-actions.
  + Work with Marketing staff to provide queries, data, or other assistance needed to deliver personalized promotions, trigger-based messages, and drip campaigns.
  + Provide market analysis and customer acquisition data to assist with campaign promotional offers, target lists

  + Create clear and concise reports with data visualizations to communicate key findings and actionable insights to marketing teams and senior management.
  + Create weekly/monthly reporting on marketing efforts (traditional, digital, and alternative) of products and services.
  + Track key metrics like click-through rates, conversion rates, and ROI across different marketing channels to evaluate campaign effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
  + Work with other departments and teams to coordinate data importing, reporting, and other tasks.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities**

* Exceptional analytical and logic skills

* Knowledge of MCIF database system management

* Knowledge of statistical analysis and methodology
* Advanced skill level in Excel

Bachelor's degree in marketing, information science or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience AND 5 years' experience in a data analytics role.

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst with Top Secret Clearance
description:
Description

Founded in 1989, CALNET, Inc. has become one of the fastest growing privately held companies in the Technology, Intelligence Analysis, and Language Services consulting arena. Headquartered in Reston, VA, CALNET employees deliver true value to our customers by employing the best practices, world-class technologies industry expertise, in every project. CALNET is ISO 9001, ISO 20000, and CMMI-Level III certified

As a Prime Government Contractor for a U.S Army, we are currently searching for a talented, professional **Senior Business Systems Analyst** in Quantico, VA.

**About the Job**

In this opportunity the objective of this new CMS enterprise environment is to provide US Army LE stakeholders with the enhanced capability to rapidly and efficiently manage a variety of LE and Criminal Intelligence (CrimIntel) functions, as well as a broader range of senior executive reporting requirements. We will provide IT support services to help DACID operate, maintain, and secure the existing CIMS environment in support of the Army LE mission under DACID’s expanding role in the law enforcement community.

Responsible for formulating and defining systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and good understanding of applicable business system and government requirements. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems to include analysis of business and user needs, documents requirements, and translates into proper system requirements. Provides input to risk management framework process activities and related documentation (system life-cycle support

plans, concept of operations, operational procedures and maintenance training materials). Requires knowledge of cybersecurity, privacy principles, and organizational requirements. Skill in determining how mission systems operate and how changes affect systems operations. Research current technology to understand capabilities or required of mission systems. Collaborates with government to identify and/or develop appropriate solutions. Ability to effectively communicate with others.

**Job Requirements**

MS/MA in Information Technology with concentration in business analytics with 10 years’ experience **OR**BA/BS in Information Technology with concentration in business analytics and 12 years’ experience. Top Secret Clearance is required for this position.

Must a total of one (1) role-based Microsoft Certification from the following:

* Power BI Data Analyst Associate
* Power Platform Fundamentals
* Azure Data Scientist Associate
* Azure AI Engineer Associate
* AI Engineer Associate (365)
* Power Platform App Maker Associate
* Power Automate RPA Developer Associate
* Teams Application Developer Associate
* Azure Data Engineer Associate
* Azure Developer Associate
* Power Platform Functional Consultant Associate

This opportunity is in Quantico, VA.

CALNET, Inc. offers a competitive salary and a generous benefits package. This package includes medical, dental, vision, life, short- and long-term disability insurances, a 401(k)-retirement savings plan, and generous leave time.

CALNET, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EEO/M/F/D/V

title: Compensation Analyst
description:
**Compensation Analyst**
------------------------

Sunstate Equipment Co.: Where Safety and People are Core Values

We care about our People, and it shows!

**Hiring Immediately;** Pay dependent on experience; Salary + Annual Bonus, PAID WEEKLY!

**Typical Schedule: Monday – Friday Typical hours 8-5**

### **Sunstate Advantages**

* Strong medical, dental, and vision insurance plans
* 401K with a company match
* Paid Holidays
* Vacation/PTO + Sick Leave

Position Summary: The Compensation Analyst plays a critical role in supporting the design, implementation, and ongoing administration of Sunstate Equipment’s compensation programs. This position is responsible for conducting thorough analyses of internal and external compensation data to ensure the organization's pay practices are competitive, equitable, and compliant with all applicable regulations. A key focus of this role is the active management and optimization of the compensation incentive software system, including configuration, troubleshooting, and reporting. The Compensation Analyst collaborates cross-functionally with Human Resources, Payroll and business leaders to deliver data-driven insights and maintain operational excellence in compensation processes.

### **Qualifications:**

* Minimum 5 years of compensation administration, Finance, or data analysis experience
* Proven track record of administering and maintaining compensation systems or platforms, preferably incentive or sales performance management (Xactly, CaptivateIQ etc)
* Bachelor’s degree in human resources, Business, Finance, or related field preferred
* High comfort level working with HRIS, Payroll systems and Excel (VLOOKUP, Pivot tables, formulas)
* Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) or similar certification a plus
* Excellent attention to detail and analytical problem-solving skills
* Experience supporting implementation or enhancement of compensation software tools
* Strong proficiency in commission and bonus processing systems, including system configuration, data integration, testing and trouble shooting
* Strong communication and confidentiality handling

### **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

#### **Salary Administration:**

* Administer software systems used to calculate and distribute sales and bonus compensation.

* Assist in the administration of the annual merit increase process, including data analysis, budgeting, and communication.

* Ensure compliance with company policies, local regulations, and best practices related to compensation.

### **Compensation Planning:**

* Support the design and implementation of new or revised compensation programs.

* Contribute to the communication and education of compensation programs to employees and managers.

#### **Data Management and Reporting:**

* Maintain accurate and up-to-date compensation data in HRIS or compensation management systems including sales compensation software systems.

* Generate reports and analyze data to provide insights on compensation trends, cost projections, and compliance.

#### **Compensation Analysis**

#### **Market Research**

#### **Compliance**

  

**Why Choose Us?**

At Sunstate, every employee is valued, respected, and fairly compensated. More importantly, every employee has a voice that deserves to be heard. We are working hard to challenge the typical ways of business and develop an environment where our employees feel safe, comfortable, and look forward to coming to work. No matter which location you visit, you can’t help but feel the close-knit work-family environment.

We have strategically and organically grown our company from within, promoting from the ground up and providing employees with opportunities to explore their different passions within our own walls. This culture allows our people to develop valuable, marketable skills they can use throughout their career. Plus, with benefits like Baby Bonding, My Holiday vacation time, and discounts on everything from movie tickets to cell phone bills, we’re constantly evolving our resources to provide our people with tools to make their lives easier!

  

Sunstate Equipment Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

A Drug Free Workplace and Participates in E-Verify

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.
company_description:
Offering Construction Rental Services Since 1977

Sunstate Equipment is changing the way people rent construction equipment and we’re looking for passionate, creative, and dedicated people.

title: Analyst, Strategy and Data Analytics - Tarrytown
description:
The **Analyst, Strategy and Data Analytics** will be heavily involved in creating analysis driven business intelligence solutions. This role will also work closely across revenue cycle and finance business functions to investigate data and analysis; and then work with physicians, in the field, to review productivity reports. Extensive travel to all office sites to meet with internal stakeholders will be required. The successful candidate will create data solutions and thrive in turning complex data sets into meaningful insights that drive business decisions.

**Essential responsibilities Include but are not limited to the following:**

* Learn and extensively study the collection of productivity reports in the Strategy and Data Analytics and Financial Accounting team systems.
* Practice intensely on excel including but not limited to courses assigned by the DSBD that will include VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Pagination, Conditional Formatting (color coding by values), Cross Tab etc.
* Learn Tableau reporting system
* Benchmark performance/data from similar clinical practice sites for future comparison and analysis on productivity
* Analyze departmental functions and recommend measures to improve fiscal performance
* Develop presentations for the business analytics department, as well as for physician recruitment and development, as needed
* Meet with physicians in conjunction with the DSBD and other analysts, as needed.
* Train, learn and understand the functions of physician productivity and dashboards, and be prepared to interface with clinicians on the meaning and actionable data.
* Recommend opportunities for optimized data reporting and analysis.
* Perform/manage other projects and tasks as assigned by DSBD

**Educational Requirements:**

* Bachelor's Degree with specialization in Business Administration, Finance or related field.
* Business analysis experience strongly preferred.
* Health care industry experience preferred.

**Other Duties**

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a completely comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required for this position. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time, with or without notice.

**We offer a competitive salary with a comprehensive benefits package including**

Medical/Dental/Vision insurance, Company paid long term disability, Flexible spending account, Company paid life insurance, Voluntary life insurance, 401k, Pet insurance.

**Company Description**  
ENT and Allergy Associates, LLP is the largest and most comprehensive ear, nose, throat, allergy and audiology practice in the nation with over 55 offices and over 220 physicians. Each ENT and Allergy Associates clinical location provides access to a full complement of services, including General Adult and Pediatric ENT, Voice and Swallowing, Facial Plastics and Reconstructive Surgery, Disorders of the Inner Ear and Dizziness, Asthma, Clinical Immunology, Diagnostic Audiology, Hearing Aid dispensing, Sleep and CT Services. ENTA has a clinical alliance with The Mount Sinai Hospital for the treatment of diseases of the head and neck and esophageal cancer and a partnership with the American Cancer Society to educate and treat patients with smoking disorders and cancer. The Practice has also expanded its clinical capabilities to include advanced Immunodeficiency trials.

title: AMT ANALYST- STAFF-SR
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW:**

El Paso Electric (EPE) is a regional energy provider that is engaged in generation, transmission, and distribution service to power approximately 460,000 customers in a 10,000-square mile area of the Rio Grande Valley in west Texas and southern New Mexico. We invite you to visit epelectric.com to learn more about EPE and our strategic initiatives. Join our EPE Team, and TOGETHER, we will transform the energy landscape.

**DATE POSTED:** **06/16/25** **CLOSING DATE:** **06/23/25**

**GRADE LEVEL:** 52-53

**DEPARTMENT**: Asset Mgmt Technologies

**STARTING SALARY:** $68,700 - $106,000 Salary is commensurate with experience.

**JOB FAMILY SUMMARY PURPOSE:**

Under the general direction of the Supervisor - Operations Technologies Support, the AMT Analyst performs all functions necessary to successfully manage and direct specific business assignments within the OTS Department. Work assignments include GIS and Work Management data scrub, distribution and TSR mapping, end user application training and support, systems analysis and project support.

**EDUCATION:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Computer Information Systems, Electrical Engineering, Geography (with an emphasis in Geographical Information Systems (GIS) and/or GIS Certificate) or related field; or an equivalent combination of related education, training and experience.

**EXPERIENCE:**

* 3 years or more experience required.

**MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:**

* Knowledge of personal computer (PC) configuration and support experience, and a combination of programming or scripting and PC configuration and support experience.

* Experience in Information Technology focused on project management, systems integration, systems analysis and design, and knowledge of principles, practices, standards, and methodologies, including requirements definition, documentation techniques, and system support.

* Experience as a data analyst in a comparable environment, with exposure to related business and system analysis activities.

* Experience working with Geographic Information Systems (e.g. ESRI ArcMap/ArcGIS Pro) and Work Management Systems (e.g. CGI OG Work, IBM Maximo) preferred.

* Ability to provide oversight of outsourced deliverables, understand outsourcing contracts and measure service level agreements.

* Ability to readily learn new skill sets and adapt to new processes and procedures as needed.

* Ability to create documentation of developed or configured applications and internal processes and procedures, develop reporting database files, methods of accountability, train end-users and develop training materials.

* Knowledge of and the ability to interpret National Electrical Safety Code (NESC) and other codes and regulations pertaining to the design and construction of electrical facilities.

* Ability to obtain extensive knowledge of Company policies and procedures relative to department operations, easement requirements and acceptable construction methods.

* Ability to follow detailed instructions especially the safety requirements when working near energized lines.

* Ability to effectively analyze and resolve complex problems concurrently.

* Possess strong leadership and team building skills.

* Effective verbal and written communication skills.

* Ability to maintain effective working relationships with officers, managers, fellow employees, and the general public.

* Ability to maintain a strong sense of propriety concerning confidential matters.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

* Performs advanced queries and analysis using Geographic Information Systems (e.g., ESRI ArcMap/ArcGIS Pro), Work Management Systems (e.g., OpenGrid Work, IBM Maximo, Cascade), engineering software tools (e.g., SpidaMin, SpidaCalc, ETAP), or any other used tools as appropriate

* Create web maps using ESRI technology, reports, metrics, and/or dashboards using different technologies such as PowerBI, IBM Cognos, ArcGIS Dashboards.

* Assists during the review and development of projects for new implementation and upgrades of TSS software applications as well as applies the PMI methodology to act as a project manager during the creation of internal TSS projects (i.e., new web applications, scripts, and software integrations).

* Generates and provides geospatial and asset-related data in response to Requests for Information (RFIs) from various departments across the company.

* Provides OTS application end-user support. Assists end-users with application system or training related problems.

* As assigned, actively participates in Geographic Information Systems, Work Management Systems, engineering software tools, or any other computer system technology special projects supported by the OTS Department as needed.

* Assists in the mapping of Distribution and TSR assets to support departmental objectives and as needed based on current mapping workload demands.

* Participates in OTS – Client Governance Committees as assigned.

* Develops key processes within the assigned functional group, coordinates development and updates with the Process Control Analysts.

* Performs work with considerable latitude and limited supervision.

* Valid driver’s license and be in compliance with the Company’s Driving Program policy.

* Complies with all applicable Company policies, procedures and code of ethics as well as all applicable governmental laws and regulations to include employment, safety and environmental standards and regulations.

* Perform other related tasks that are not included, but are within the context of the duties defined.

**If interested in applying for this position, you must apply on-line by** **5:00 PM, June 23, 2025.**

title: Data Analyst
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:**

  

The Data Analyst performs technical efforts including creating and modifying alarm accounts, buildings and contact information with various systems. Their primary purpose is the information management of an alarm monitoring system and the current information system in order to assist with dispatching operations of the Federal Protective Service.

  

**PAY TRANSPARENCY/ COMPENSATION:**

$17.20/hr

$4.93 Health & Welfare

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Validate/maintain information for all alarm systems and buildings
* Update building profiles with special instructions regarding emergency and non-emergency events to assist dispatching operations
* Validate/maintain information on all alarm accounts, to include physical demographics, local responders, government agency contacts, zones, and panel information
* Perform quality assurance for all information systems
* Maintain all tracking and logging tools providing statistical data
* Log operation stats
* Assist in providing training to personnel on the operations of each system

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* US Citizenship
* Candidates will be required to undergo a background check
* High School diploma or GED
Computer skills* - Utilizes a personal computer with word processing, spreadsheet and related software with reasonable speed and accuracy
* Proficient in Word, Excel, and data entry
* Strong command of the English language
* Ability to pass MRPT suitability requirements

  

**BENEFITS**

  

Constellis offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefits package that reflect its commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace.

  

* Medical, Vision & Dental Insurance
* Paid Time-Off Program & Company Paid Holidays
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Insurance: Basic Life & Supplemental Life
* Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
* Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
* Personal Development & Learning Opportunities
* On-the-job Training, Skills Development & Certifications
* Employee Referral Program
* Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach

  

**WORKING CONDITIONS**

  

Business work hours are Monday through Friday, actual shifts during the day to be determined. Federal holidays observed.

  

**PHYSICAL REQUIRMENTS**

  

Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves extended periods of sitting while engaged with a computer terminal or phone. Must have close visual and audio acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; determining the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of work; or to make general observations of facilities or structures. Must meet all physical and psychological standards as required by the contract.
company_description: Constellis is the largest and most diverse non-financial risk management company in the United States, offering turn-key solutions to address our customers’ most complex challenges around the globe.

title: Research and Policy (Data Analyst) Intern
description:
Additional Information

* Agency Logo:
* Requisition ID: INT003C
* Number of Openings: 1
* Shift: Day Job
* Posting End Date: Jul 5, 2025

  

**Closing Date: July 5, 2025**

**Intern Dates:** August 2025 through December 2025

**Pay Rate:****The Hourly pay rates are based on the following:**

* **Current Undergraduate Student: $14.00**

* **Current Graduate Student: $16.00**

**Positions Available:** 1

**Hours:** Minimum of 20 hours per week – up to but not to exceed 29 hours per week.

* *Maximum of 29 hours per week cannot be exceeded.*

**Location:** 2 Martin Luther King Jr. Dr. SE. Suite 754 East Tower Atlanta, GA

  

**Agency Overview**

Bright from the Start: Georgia Department of Early Care and Learning (DECAL) is responsible for meeting the child care and early education needs of Georgia’s children and their families. It administers the nationally recognized Georgia’s Pre-K Program, licenses child care centers and home-based child care, administers Georgia's Childcare and Parent Services (CAPS) program, federal nutrition programs, and manages Quality Rated, Georgia’s community-powered child care rating system.

The department also houses the Head Start State Collaboration Office, distributes federal funding to enhance the quality and availability of child care, and works collaboratively with Georgia child care resource and referral agencies and organizations throughout the state to enhance early care and education.

**Position Overview**

The Research and Policy intern will have the opportunity to support and assist with finding innovative ways to conduct research studies, statistical analyses, and surveying. Intern will work closely with various team members across the Research and Policy division. Duties include:

* Compiling, reviewing, and analyzing statistical data. This includes creating data sets from administrative data, analyzing publicly available data, and communicating findings.
* Developing and fielding surveys for DECAL divisions and DECAL research and evaluation projects.
* Creating research and evaluation materials and visuals. This includes presentations, handouts, data visualizations, clean data sets, and analysis summaries.
* Assisting with team communications and coordination activities.
* Conducting literature reviews related to key early education topics such as Quality Rated and Improvement Systems, early childhood language and literacy, and new research methodologies.
* Working with other Research and Policy Analysis team members and QIP staff on various projects and assignments.

**Learning Objectives**
=======================

Gain knowledge of grant and program administration and the Federal regulations guiding the programs; knowledge of the state of early childhood education in the State of Georgia; knowledge of governmental agency operations and reporting needs of a high performing state agency; knowledge about how a state agency uses data and research to inform policy decisions.

**Interest Areas**
==================

Quantitative and Qualitative Analysis, Research Methodologies, Policy Analysis and Development, and Early Childhood Education.

**Entry Qualifications:**

* Currently enrolled student, part-time or full-time, with a 3.0 GPA or higher *(must submit transcript to verify enrollment and GPA)* OR no more than six months past receiving their degree at time of employment by DECAL.

* Georgia resident or attending a Georgia college, university, or law school.

* Working level skill in the use of MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook).

* Good research and analytical skills.

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Advanced level skill in the use of Excel.

* Excellent business writing, organizational, and computer skills.

* High level of skill in research and analysis with the ability to form conclusions and recommendations based on analysis.

* Understanding of quantitative and qualitative analysis.

  

**Physical Requirements and Performance Aptitudes:**

* Requires close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading and visual inspection.

* Requires the ability to review, classify, categorize, prioritize, and/or analyze data. Includes exercising discretion in determining data classification.

* Requires the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication.

* Requires the ability to exercise judgment, decisiveness and creativity in situations involving the evaluation of information against sensory, judgmental, or subjective criteria, as opposed to that which is clearly measurable or verifiable.

  

Bright from the Start: Georgia Department of Early Care and Learning is an equal opportunity employer. A background check will be completed upon hire, which may consist of any of the following: criminal history, credit history, employment history, educational records, IRS records and driving records.

  

If you are an individual with a disability who may require assistance or other reasonable accommodation in order to participate in the selection process for this position, you may contact our HR department at 404-656-3922. Due to the volume of submissions received by this office, information concerning application or interview status cannot be provided in writing, over the phone, or in person. All applicants who submit a complete application package will be considered but may not necessarily receive notification or an interview. The job posting may be subject to being closed at any time without notice. Only those qualified candidates who are selected for an interview shall receive notification upon the filling of this vacancy.

Bright from the Start: Georgia Department of Early Care and Learning is an equal opportunity employer.

  

Student enrolled in a Georgia high school, technical college, or university/college. Must be currently enrolled during the internship.

title: Staff Market Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for** ***all*****.**

Micron Technology is a world leader in innovating memory and storage solutions that accelerate the transformation of information into intelligence, inspiring the world to learn, communicate and advance faster than ever.

As Analyst, Market Intelligence at Micron Technology, Inc., you will be part of a team responsible for end market and memory supply-demand analysis, competitive analysis, market research and providing actionable insights!

The Staff Analyst would have achieved results in a fast paced, dynamic environment. You will be self-motivated and self-directed, but with a strong team ethic. In addition, the individual must have the abilities to work effectively cross-functionally, coordinate priorities and initiatives, troubleshoot and analyze sophisticated problems, and lead multiple projects simultaneously.

**Responsibilities include, but not limited to:**

* Maintain relationship with Market Research analysts
* Drive adoption of AI in Market Intelligence activities
* Work collaboratively with BU Marketing groups to help them size market opportunities, such as PC and automotive markets
* Build and maintain top-down demand models for major end markets
* Lead share point site used to share market research reports and internal analysis
* Analyze data to explain historical or forecasted trends and recommend action
* Conduct research for special projects and macro-economic overviews by applying company filings, equity/market research and internal data
* Participate in competitor analysis and summarize output for company wide use
* Work with marketing and investor relations teams to provide market trend data for use in earnings calls, analyst updates and market presentations

**Preferred Qualification and Education:**

* BS/BA degree in a quantitative field; MBA from a world-class business school is preferred
* 5 years of experience in market intelligence, business development, strategy or corporate development
* Familiarity with semiconductor, memory and/or electronics industries
* Proven ability to perform market/opportunity analysis
* Ability to work with senior executives and provide high quality responses on a short deadline
* Strong attention to detail and focus: your work will be used at the highest levels of decision-making and collaborators will expect to use your information without qualification or second-guessing its accuracy
* Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint to perform analyses and present results crisply.
* Comfort level and flexible with changing needs and priorities, ambiguity, information overload, short deadlines

The US base salary range that Micron Technology estimates it could pay for this full-time position is:

$119,500.00 - $323,500.00

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries of the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional job-related factors, including knowledge, skills, experience, tenure and relevant education or training. The pay scale is subject to change depending on business needs. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Additional compensation may include benefits, discretionary bonuses and equity.

As a world leader in the semiconductor industry, Micron is dedicated to your personal wellbeing and professional growth. Micron benefits are designed to help you stay well, provide peace of mind and help you prepare for the future. We offer a choice of medical, dental and vision plans in all locations enabling team members to select the plans that best meet their family healthcare needs and budget. Micron also provides benefit programs that help protect your income if you are unable to work due to illness or injury, and paid family leave. Additionally, Micron benefits include a robust paid time-off program and paid holidays. For additional information regarding the Benefit programs available, please see the Benefits Guide posted on micron.com/careers/benefits.

Micron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

To learn more about Micron, please visit micron.com/careers

US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s People Organization at hrsupport\\_na@micron.com or 1-800-336-8918 (select option #3)

Micron Prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and other international and industry labor standards.

Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.

title: Senior Analyst, Healthcare Analytics and Data Insights
description:
We are currently seeking a full-time **Senior Analyst, Healthcare Analytics and Data Insights** to join our on-site wellness team located in **Jersey City, NJ.**

**This is an in-office role based out of Jersey City, NJ.**

**Job Overview:**

The Sr. Analyst, Healthcare Analytics and Data Insights will report directly to the Optum Workplace Well-being Senior Wellness Director. The primary responsibility of this role is to represent Optum Workplace Well-being at our client and work cross-functionally with the client’s Benefits and Wellness leadership and team to provide reporting and data analysis, as well as input to strategy for metric definition, collection, and communication. Additional duties include identifying and initiating additional business opportunities for both Optum Workplace Well-being and the client. Suitable candidates must be well versed in descriptive and predictive analytics as well as presenting their findings to a non-technical audience.

Using a range of analytical techniques and methods, tools and approaches, you will own and lead the generation of quantitative insights on people and health data. All methodologies must align to data privacy principles for safeguarding health data.

**What you will do:**

* Data collation, reconciling complex data sets.
* Exploratory data analysis.
* Hypothesis testing based on findings from exploratory analysis.
* Work cross-functionally, liaising with Benefits and Wellness leadership to set and execute on strategic agenda for global and regional metric collection and presentation.
* Establish, refine, and develop metrics that support analytics projects across Benefits and Wellness globally.
* Create user friendly reporting to enable Benefits and Wellness leadership to understand and communicate benefits and wellness trends.
* Collaborate with client’s data warehouse vendor to implement strategic reporting and data analytics strategy; use data analysis to identify opportunities and implement solutions to improve health outcomes,
* Provide input on the development of ROI/VOI reporting for Benefits and Wellness programs.
* Collect, review and report on data from global teams. Ensure global consistency and timely completion of deliverables.
* Provide data and reporting to support ad hoc requests from the client’s businesses, including data for reports required for regulatory, compliance or tax purposes.

**What we are looking for:**

* Advanced MS Excel skills to connect to external data sources and constructing large/complex data sets to presenting the data through presentational packs
* Bachelor (minimum) or Masters degree in data science or equivalent
* Significant experience of analyzing data from a range of sources and working in a corporate environment
* Confident setting up the architecture and producing visual concepts utilizing Excel and/or other analytical tools
* Experience and knowledge of SQL
* Excellent problem-solving skills - be a logical thinker and have an analytical mind; identify ways to enhance presentation of data; ask questions and challenge status quo
* Demonstrate detailed knowledge of reports and data sources and ability to design, generate and improve according to the needs of the business
* Able to demonstrate a clear attention to detail, ensuring that all relevant documentation and report specification documents are accurate, meaningful, easily understood and fit for the purpose for which they are intended
* Ability to synthesize large sets of data and expertise in running data queries
* Experience managing projects across multiple departments with various stakeholders
* Experience working with global teams across multiple time zones
* Flexibility to adapt to evolving priorities in a dynamic environment.

**About Us:**

Plus One, part of the Optum Workplace Well-being portfolio of services, provides fitness and well-being services to clients across a broad range of industries, driving employee engagement in health and wellness programs. Our services include fitness, nutrition, ergonomics, wellness coaching and health promotion. Our team members believe that the most effective way to help people adopt a healthier lifestyle is through personal connections infused with hospitality, empathy and a lot of fun.

**Perks of working at Plus One, an Optum company\\*:**

**Health and financial:**

* Medical plan choices with Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) options
* Dental and Vision coverage plans
* 401(k) Retirement & Savings Plan
* Life Insurance (team member, spouse and dependents)
* Short and Long Term Disability Plans
* Accident & Critical Illness Insurance
* Transportation and Parking Plans
* Paid parental leave

**Well-being:**

* Paid time off
* Wellness rewards program
* Free memberships to various fitness facilities and wellness subscriptions
* 24/7 health and wellness support through the Employee Assistance program
* Entertainment and consumer discounts
* Dedication to ensuring a cohesive and inclusive culture led by an internal diversity, equity and inclusion council

**Growth and development:**

* Free professional development courses through internal learning management systems
* Discounted certifications through industry leading agencies
* Free CPR/AED certifications
* Free continuing education courses and credits
* Employee Referral Reward program
* Please note, some of the benefits listed above are only available to team members who work full time hours.

**Equal opportunity statement**

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere. Plus One, an Optum Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

**For residents of California, Colorado, New York City, and Washington only:** The annual salary for this position ranges from $120,000 - $140,000. Pay is based on several factors including, but not limited to, education, work experience, certifications, geographic differentials, and other business and organizational needs. In addition to the hourly rate, Plus One offers a comprehensive benefits package (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements), which includes health insurance, life and disability benefits, 401(k) plan, and paid time off. Plus One, an Optum Company, adheres to all federal, state, and local minimum wage requirements.

title: On-site Data Analyst
description:
"Grounded in safety, quality, and ethics, our experts lead their fields and guide our work with rigor, a creative spirit, and vision for growth. We draw from more than 20 technical specialties around the globe and are committed to fostering an inclusive community of diverse talents, backgrounds, and expertise. We’re a place to apply your passion and collaborate with top environmental talents on work that’s critical to our clients and the communities they support. Join a team that has the environment down to a science

Your Opportunity

Stantec Government Services (GS) is seeking a creative and resourceful On-site Data Analyst to support Range Management and other mission-related functions at the Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Center (MCAGCC) located in Twentynine Palms, CA. Stantec GS is a professional infrastructure and environmental services company, with expertise in the planning and implementation of encroachment control and mitigation efforts at military installations and associated operational equities throughout the United States. We seek: - Highly motivated and experienced team players

* Individuals who think and create, enhancing our Company and our clients with a steady flow of fresh ideas, new perspectives, and energy Your Key Responsibilities

The successful candidate will have experience with business process analysis, database design, content management, process automation, data analytics, streamlining of information exchange, and other related improvements. The position will require design input, implementation, and management of business process improvements that leverage Microsoft Office 365 and content management service cloud environments and utilize Microsoft’s PowerBI and other data source connector applications to improve data access, integration, visualization, decision support and management. This position will be full-time on-site at MCAGCC Twentynine Palms, CA. "

﻿

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. "

title: Data Analyst Lead - Data Governance
description:
Infosys Ltd. is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented **Data Analyst Lead Governance.** Reporting Focus to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will leverage your deep understanding of the financial services domain and strong analytical skills to ensure the quality, traceability, integrity, and privacy of critical data, with a specific focus on adhering to data governance frameworks, data privacy regulations, and supporting regulatory reporting requirements. You will be instrumental in identifying data risks, establishing data quality frameworks, implementing data lineage solutions, ensuring data privacy compliance, and ensuring adherence to financial regulations. You will be part of a collaborative and growth-oriented culture at Infosys, where your contributions will have a direct impact on our clients' success in a highly regulated environment.  
  
**Required Qualifications:**

* Candidate must be located within commuting distance of **Richardson****, TX****, Hartford, CT, OR Hartford, CT** or be willing to relocate to the areas.
* Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
* All applicants authorized to work in the United States are encouraged to apply.
* At least 4 years of experience with Information Technology.
* Experience on Data Governance, Metadata Management, Data Catalog, Data Quality

  
**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Certifications in any DG tool like Collibra, Informatica, Alation, etc.
* Experience with any Data Governance tools - Collibra, Informatica EDC/AXON/IDQ, Alation
* Good understanding of data integration, data quality and data architecture
* Experience in Relational Modeling, Dimensional Modeling and Modeling of Unstructured Data
* knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL, Unix shell scripting
* Good understanding of Agile software development frameworks
* Ability to work in teams in a diverse, multi-stakeholder environment comprising of Business and Technology teams
* Experience and desire to work in a global delivery environment

*The job may entail extensive travel. The job may also entail sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Candidates should be able to effectively communicate by telephone, email, and face to face*

  
**About Us**  
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.  
  
**Infosys provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race; color; sex; gender identity; sexual orientation; religious practices and observances; national origin; pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; status as a protected veteran or spouse/family member of a protected veteran; or disability.**

title: Financial Business Analyst
description:

This position’s primary responsibility will be to help clients with strategy definition, value realization, implementation, and operations. The role holder will be a key player in the consulting team that helps discover and define the problem statement, evaluates the solution options and makes recommendations. You will create detailed design, controls and process artifacts and implement the process deployment. You will also support knowledge transfer with the objective of providing value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.  
  
Candidate must be located within commuting distance of **Bridgewater NJ** be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel to project locations  
  
**Required Qualifications:**

title: Business Development Data Analyst
description:
**Company Name**: IRYS Technologies / DTSI

**Location**: San Antonio, TX / Remote Hybrid

**Duration**: 6 weeks

**Clearance Requirement**: Secret Clearance Preferred (or ability to obtain)

**Reports To**: Chief Operating OfficerBusiness Development Manager

**Job Summary**
---------------

IRYS Technologies, in partnership with DTSI, is seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Business Development (BD) Data Analyst to support our business development efforts in the federal government sector. The ideal candidate will leverage data analytics, AI, and technical resources to identify trends, support growth strategies, and drive successful federal contract bids. This position will collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights, ensuring our company remains competitive in the federal contracting space.

  

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

**Data AnalysisReporting:**
---------------------------

* Gather, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to inform business development  
  strategies targeting federal contracts.
* Develop dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to present key  
  metrics and actionable insights for stakeholders.
* Monitor and evaluate performance metrics related to government bids, contract wins, and  
  agency engagements.

**MarketCompetitive Intelligence:**

* Conduct research on federal government agencies, procurement trends, and competitor  
  activities to identify business opportunities.
* Analyze federal spending data (e.g., from USAspending.gov or FPDS) to identify new  
  business opportunities and inform proposal development.

**Proposal Support:**

* Provide data-driven insights to support the proposal team in responding to RFPs and RFQs.
* Assist in the analysis of bid pricing strategies, identifying opportunities for cost reductions,  
  and optimizing competitive positioning.

**CollaborationStakeholder Engagement:**

* Collaborate with business development, capture management, and proposal teams to provide  
  data insights that inform go/no-go decisions and overall pursuit strategies.
* Present findings to senior management and government stakeholders to support decision making

**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------

* Experience: 5 - 8 years of related experience
* Education: Bachelor's Degree or related experience
* Security Clearance: Top Secret
* Knowledge of Government Contracting Procedures and Policies. Federal and Department of Defense Information Technology Landscape
* Proficient in Data Analysis (Statistical, Predictive, Querying, BI Tools) and Dashboards and Metrics - (Data Visualization, Storytelling with Data).
* Self-motivated, collaborative and detail oriented

**Work Environment**
--------------------

* **Setting**: Office in downtown San Antonio with hybrid remote options.
* **Culture**: Dynamic, collaborative team environment focused on pushing technological boundaries.
* **Security**: Work involves sensitive systems, requiring strict adherence to confidentiality and security protocols.

**InclusionDiversity**  
DTSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

**Disclosure**  
DTSI is an equal opportunity employer that uses E-Verify to confirm work authorization. Background investigations may be conducted to determine applicant's eligibility for a Department of Defense security clearance.

**EEOC Know Your Rights**  
**Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision**

title: Data Analyst (Full-Time)(Hybrid)
description:
OrthoNebraska creates the inspired healthcare experience all people deserve by giving people a direct path to personalized care and life-enhancing outcomes. With a focus on safety and people, we set the bar high in providing high-quality care with an unmatched experience. Our team members are critical to our success and growth and are rewarded for their dedication and hard work. IF this sounds like the type of team and environment you want to be a part of apply today!

**Position Summary:** The **Data Analyst**, is resourceful, excels at creative problem-solving, and enjoys learning new tools and technologies.

**Position details**

Status

Full-Time

Shift

Days

FTE / Hours

1.0 / 40

Schedule

Mon - Fri:

  

Hybrid

Requires 1 day per week onsite

  

**Position Requirements**

**Education**: Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred OR combined education and work experience. Master's degree preferred.

**Licensure**: N/A

**Certification**: N/A

**Experience**: 2+ years of experience in Analytics role, preferred. Previous experience as an analyst preferred. Exposure to financial and operational data, medical records, and information management systems preferred.

**Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities**

* Strong analytical skills, with experience in data analysis, performance measurement.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and inform multidisciplinary teams.
* Proven time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
* Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
* Experience with data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Looker, or Tableau.
* Familiarity with data platforms like such as Snowflake or Databricks is highly desirable.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL, or R is preferred.
* Strong understanding of healthcare data standards, privacy regulations (e.g., HIPAA), and security best practices preferred.

**Essential Job Functions**

* Data Capture and Provisioning
  + Collect, validate, and maintain data from multiple sources.
  + Serve as a data strategist to identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through our framework.
  + Demonstrate the ability to effectively understand and query large databases.
  + Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data for organizational decision-making.
  + Design and implement both one-time and continuous data analysis processes.
  + Relate captured data to organizational processes and workflows.
  + Optimize data collections processes and drive improvements in data governance and quality control.
  + Actively monitor and contain cloud resource utilization and expense through code efficiencies and deploying optimal solutions.
* Data Analysis, Business Intelligence (BI), and Visualization
* Evaluate and analyze data for trends, variances, and opportunities with clear objectives in mind to support key initiatives and decision-making.
* Create meaningful reports, dashboards, and scorecards tracking key quality performance indicators (KPIs).
* Use data visualization, analysis and automation tools to uncover technical findings and translate them into actionable insights for key stakeholders.
* Exercise creativity and initiative in solving complex problems.
* Provide education on and drive adoption of self-service analytics tools and data strategies.
* Collaboration
  + Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including leadership, clinicians, and data professionals, to design and implement data-driven solutions.
* Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders to drive informed decision-making.
* Build and maintain strong working relationships with stakeholders to address evolving healthcare information needs.
* Contribute to the design of enterprise dashboards which display company metrics with interactive, multi-dimensional visualization enabling stakeholder decision-making.
* Promote data literacy and a self-service approach to data, enabling stakeholders to access information they need.
* Participate in multiple projects supporting organizational objectives using project management and process improvement skills.
* Provide data support and feedback for various initiatives, including ongoing metrics and dashboards, performance improvement efforts, and business case analysis.
* Professional growth and development
* Stay current with advancements in healthcare industrytechnology, data analytics, cloud technology and regulatory requirements
* Seek opportunities for continuous skill and competency development.
* Explore innovative analytical tools with the goal of improving existing processes.
* Support the planning, implementation, and monitoring of processes and systems to optimize data workflows.
* Identify ways to improve services provided to the organization (e.g., technology enhancements, improved information delivery, integration of disparate data sources).
* Take advantage of opportunities to attend classes, workshops, seminars, and conferences to expand knowledge and skills in healthcare analytics.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Physical requirements:** This position is classified as Sedentary Work in the Dictionary of Occupational Titles, requiring the exertion of up to 10 pounds of force occasionally) up to (33% of the time) and/or a negligible amount of force frequently (33%-66% of the time) to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.

title: Business Information Analyst Senior
description:
**Business Information Analyst Senior**

**Location:** This role requires associates to be in-office 1 day per week, fostering collaboration and connectivity, while providing flexibility to support productivity and work-life balance. This approach combines structured office engagement with the autonomy of virtual work, promoting a dynamic and adaptable workplace. Ideal candidates will be able to report to one of our Pulse Point locations in Mendota Heights, MN, Gilbert, MN, Atlanta, GA, Indianapolis, IN, or Chicago, IL.

The **Business Information Analyst Senior** is responsible for analyzing, reporting, and developing recommendations on data related to complex and varied business metrics. Typically provides technical assistance to lower-level staff.

**How you will make an impact:**

* Creates and maintains databases to track business performance.
* Analyzes data and summarizes performance using summary statistical procedures.
* Develops and analyzes business performance reports (e.g. for claims data, provider data, utilization data) and provides notations of performance deviations and anomalies.
* Creates and publishes periodic reports, as well as any necessary ad hoc reports.
* Takes business issues and devises the best way to develop appropriate diagnostic and/or tracking data that will translate business requirements into usable decision support tools.
* Makes recommendations based upon data analysis.

**Minimum Requirements:**

Requires a BS/BA degree in related field and a minimum of 3 years data analysis or related experience; or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background.

**Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experiences:**

* Power BI experience highly preferred.
* Tableau experience highly preferred.
* SQL experience highly preferred.
* Experience with relational databases and knowledge of query tools and statistical software highly preferred.
* Ability to manipulate large sets of data highly preferred.
* Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills highly preferred.

For candidates working in person or virtually in the below location(s), the salary\\* range for this specific position is $71,896 - $124,872

Location: Gilbert, MN, Mendota Heights, MN, Chicago, IL

In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the Company. The Company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws*.*

* The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

  

Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes for compensation from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.

Who We Are

Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. We are a Fortune 25 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve.

How We Work

At Elevance Health, we are creating a culture that is designed to advance our strategy but will also lead to personal and professional growth for our associates. Our values and behaviors are the root of our culture. They are how we achieve our strategy, power our business outcomes and drive our shared success - for our consumers, our associates, our communities and our business.

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.

Elevance Health operates in a Hybrid Workforce Strategy. Unless specified as primarily virtual by the hiring manager, associates are required to work at an Elevance Health location at least once per week, and potentially several times per week. Specific requirements and expectations for time onsite will be discussed as part of the hiring process.

The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19 and Influenza. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide an acceptable explanation. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.

Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.
