title: Data Analyst II - (Remote - US)
description:
Lensa is the leading career site for job seekers at every stage of their career. Our client, Mediavine, is seeking professionals. Apply via Lensa today!
  
  
Mediavine is seeking a Data Analyst II to join our Engineering team. We are looking for someone who enjoys solving interesting problems and wants to work with a small team of talented engineers on a product used by thousands of publishers.
  
  
**About Mediavine**
Mediavine is a fast-growing advertising management company representing over 10,000 websites in the food, lifestyle, DIY, and entertainment space. Founded by content creators, for content creators, Mediavine is a Top 20 Comscore property, exclusively reaching over 125 million monthly unique visitors. With best-in-class technology and a commitment to traffic quality and brand safety, we ensure optimal performance for our creators.
  
  
Mission & Culture
  
  
We are striving to build an inclusive and diverse team of highly talented individuals that reflect the industries we serve and the world we live in. The unique experiences and perspectives of our team members is encouraged and valued. If you are talented, driven, enjoy the pace of a start-up like environment, let’s talk!
  
  
**Position Title & Overview**
Mediavine’s Data & Analytics team is responsible for building the most effective platform and tools to help uncover opportunities in order to make informed decisions. We partner with nearly every other team in the company to help them understand behavior and performance, develop accurate predictors and build solutions that provide the best internal and external experience possible.
  
  
As a more experienced member of the team, the person in this position will bring their expertise in supporting the business by helping to guide direction through data based decisions. The Data & Analytics team consists of data analysts, data engineers and analytics engineers. This position will work closely with other team members and outside stakeholders to deliver tools and insights to move the business forward.
  
  
Our current analytics toolkit consists of DOMO and dbt running on top of a Snowflake data warehouse. We are open to new tools and expect this position to play a major role in setting the direction we take.
  
  
**Essential Responsibilities**

* Work collaboratively with the ad operations, sales and overall revenue teams to develop analytic monitoring and measurement tools that meet immediate needs
* Develop analytics that anticipate the business needs
* Inform the analytics roadmap, which includes leading projects through all phases
* Increase our teams’ ability and comfort level in answering questions through mentorship, training, and better tooling
* Create visualizations to monitor business performance and uncover interesting trends for investigation
* Communicate requirements to the data engineers to ensure the platform can support the business needs
* Contribute to anomaly investigation helping other teams identify root cause and present findings
* Define and create exception based alerting that is meaningful for specific audiences along with investigation and remediation steps
* Expand the Test and Learn process we use for exploratory data analysis and A/B testing, this includes helping stakeholders decide on testing strategy, generating baselines, approximating sample sizes and performing analysis of test results
* Work with data and analytics engineers to standardize transformation logic in the dbt layer for consistency and ease of exploration by end users
* Follow data analysis code best practices and analysis standards
* As business needs change, be flexible in learning and applying your skills and experience working with other stakeholders
* Availability to travel to on-site locations for events/conferences, team retreats and the annual all hands events (approximately 15% of the time)

**Requirements**
Location:
  
  

* Applicants must be based in the United States

**You Have**

* 4+ years of experience in a data analyst role working at scale
* 2+ years of hands on experience working with SQL (CTEs, window functions, optimization)
* Experience with one or more major BI tools (Domo\\*, Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)
* Comfortability working with multi-TB cloud data warehouses (Snowflake\\*, Big Query, Redshift)
* Experience with web analysis such as creating product funnels, user behavior, and paths
* Experience with designing and analyzing experiments including but not limited to A/B testing
* Working knowledge of data warehousing, dimensional modeling and other reporting structures
* Familiarity with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as dbt\\*, Matillion, etc.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience working on a distributed/remote team
* Ability to travel up to approx 15%

**Nice To Haves**

* 2+ years of professional analytics experience working in the Ad Tech industry with an understanding of Google Ad Manager, SSPs, DSPs, Open vs Private Market
* Experience with R or Python for creating data models or data manipulation
* Experience with dbt and Snowflake
* The ability to make your teammates laugh (it wouldn’t hurt if you were fun to work with is what I’m saying)
* Familiarity with event tracking systems (NewRelic, Snowplow, etc)

**Benefits**

* 100% remote
* Comprehensive benefits including Health, Dental, Vision and 401k match
* Generous paid time off
* Wellness and Home Office Perks
* Up to 12 weeks of paid Parental Leave
* Inclusive Family Forming Benefits
* Professional development opportunities
* Travel opportunities for teams, our annual All Hands retreat as well as industry events

Mediavine provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
  
  
We strongly encourage minorities and individuals from underrepresented groups in technology to apply for this position.
  
  
At Mediavine, base salary is one part of our competitive total compensation and benefits package and is determined using a salary range. Individual compensation varies based on job-related factors, including business needs, experience, level of responsibility and qualifications. The base salary range for this role at the time of posting is $115,000 - $125,000 USD/yr.
  
  
If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Qlik Sense
description:
Concord isn't your typical consulting firm; we are an execution company with a passion for making things happen. Our mission is to help clients enhance customer experiences, optimize operations, and revolutionize their product offerings through seamless integration, optimization, and activation of technology and data.

We are looking for a
**Business Intelligence Analyst - Qlik**
to join the Business Intelligence Team. This position will work to create end to end solutions, helping clients organize, structure and visualize their marketing data in a way that delivers value and actionable insights. Key responsibilities will include:

* Create, prepare, and maintain databases and tables to power reports, dashboards, and downstream analysis.
* Design and build dashboards that enable actionable insight.
* Plan, design and develop a dashboard project end-to-end including data preparation and dashboard development.
* Interpret results and make recommendations for data-driven marketing decisions

**What you will be doing**

* Build and maintain dashboards in Qlik to support analysis, reporting, and performance
* optimization.
* Create and maintain customized SQL queries to build reporting data structures.
* Build and maintain database architecture, including fine tuning and optimizing queries, data pipelines, and automation workflows.
* Validate data to determine and document any gaps between available data and requirements for reporting outputs, dashboards, modeling use cases, and downstream analysis.
* Analyze and interpret marketing performance via dashboards and ad hoc analysis.
* Manage multiple client requests and detailed project activities at any one time to ensure accurate, timely and efficient reporting and analysis deliverables.

*Data visualization and SQL skills are critical for this Business Intelligence role.*
Consideration will be given to qualified candidates with varying levels of experience, with compensation commensurate with experience.

**What we are looking for**

* Advanced SQL knowledge
* Deep experience with business intelligence and visualization tools, specifically Qlik.
* Experience with Tableau, PowerBI, Quicksight, Datorama, Domo and/or Looker are nice to have
* Experience working with Google Cloud cloud-based data solutions
* Working with a leading analytics or relational database system, such as Redshift, Vertica, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, or MySQL
* Developing and implementing data transformation via ETL processes and data pipelines
* Understanding of marketing analytics or CRM analytics
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, listening and presentation skills
* The ability to work both as a team and independently
* Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, Marketing, or a related discipline

**Other experience that is helpful, but not required**

* Working with enterprise ETL software such as Databricks, Alteryx, Tableau Prep
* Working knowledge in at least one of the following scripting languages: Python or R
* Working in big data solutions such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark
* Experience using MailChimp or other CRM platforms
* Using change release processes and tools such as Git
* Working with clickstream web analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or working knowledge of the field of web analytics
* Knowledge of commonly-used digital metrics, analytic concepts, and online

**What we offer**

* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Employer contributions to Health Savings Accounts (HSA).
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) and a Lifestyle Spending Account (LSA).
* Short- and long-term disability coverage, fully paid by the employer.
* Life and AD&D insurance with optional additional coverage.
* Paid Time Off (PTO) and paid holidays.
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for personal and professional support.
* Opportunities for advancement and career growth.
* Team-building events and company-sponsored activities.

**Job specifications**

* Employment type: Full-time permanent employment at Concord.
* Location: Hybrid (1-2 days on-site) in the Kansas City area is preferred. Open to remote in other US cities.
* Interview process: (1) introductory call, (2) take-home assessment, and (3) interview with the hiring manager.
* Requirements: Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future.

title: Senior Data Analyst
job_function: Information Technology, Analyst, and Product Management
description:
Pivotal Partners is exclusively partnered to scale a Series B ($40mil) Gen AI startup. We are looking to aggressively expand our presence by hiring a Data Analyst for our Product team.

**Location:**
US or Canada (Remote)

**Job Description:**

We’re hiring a Data Analyst to join our Product team as the technical bridge between Product, Engineering, and Go-To-Market. In this hybrid role, you'll design and maintain solution blueprints, out-of-the-box (OOB) assets, and proof-of-concept (PoC) environments that let prospects experience product value early in the sales cycle.

You’ll own how our latest GenAI innovations show up in demos and PoCs—ensuring every prototype, dashboard, and workflow reflects the cutting edge of our platform. By translating raw customer data and business goals into clear, compelling technical narratives, you’ll accelerate deals and bring critical field insights directly into the product roadmap.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design and Maintain Reusable Solution Blueprints for fraud, credit, AML, and onboarding use cases—integrating the latest product features and innovations.
* Lead Pre-Sales Prototypes and PoCs, tailoring demos to highlight core and differentiating product capabilities using real or synthetic datasets.
* Conduct Deep Data Analysis and Feature Engineering using SQL, Python, and big data tools to surface risk signals, engineer features, and build rule logic.
* Build Story-Driven and Visual Data Narratives through dashboards, notebooks, and interactive visualizations to clearly convey business value to diverse audiences.
* Create and Maintain Demo Environments, ensuring GTM teams have fast access to realistic, compelling, and up-to-date demo setups.
* Capture Field Insights and Influence Product Roadmap, channeling customer needs and solution patterns back to Product and Engineering.
* Develop Enablement Materials, including playbooks, how-to guides, and training content to support internal teams and partners.

**Requirements:**

* Experience: 7-8+ years in solution architecture, data analytics, or pre-sales engineering for B2B SaaS- MUST BE in fintech, risk, data, or AI.
* Technical Skills: Expert-level SQL and data wrangling; proficiency in Python (or R) for ad-hoc analysis and feature engineering.
* Solution Expertise: Proven ability to create PoCs/pilots that convert prospects into customers and keep demo environments current with rapid product releases.
* Domain Knowledge: Familiarity with fraud prevention, credit risk, or AML compliance is a strong plus.
company_industry: Software Development, Computer and Network Security, and Financial Services

title: Data Analyst (Health)
description:
**About The Company**
National Jewish Health is the leading respiratory hospital in the nation, serving patients and advancing medicine since 1899. Renowned for its clinical excellence and cutting-edge research, the institution has shaped healthcare delivery for over 125 years. Our Health Initiatives team supports public health programs that directly impact population health outcomes and community well-being.
  
  
**About The Role**
We are hiring a Health Data Analyst to join our Health Initiatives team. This role supports innovative healthcare programs through meaningful data collection, management, analysis, and reporting. You will be instrumental in developing insights that shape program direction, improve participant outcomes, and strengthen public health efforts.
  
  
As part of a collaborative and mission-driven team, you will contribute to impactful work that aligns with our institution’s long-standing commitment to excellence in patient care, education, and research.
  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Collect, manage, and analyze program and participant health data.
* Design, develop, and maintain Tableau dashboards and Excel-based reporting tools.
* Ensure data integrity by implementing quality assurance processes.
* Support outcome evaluations, client reports, and data-driven recommendations.
* Collaborate with stakeholders and clinical leadership to support systematic reviews and program strategies.
* Develop and optimize data reporting structures using SQL queries, VBA scripting, and other analytics tools.
* Document and address data-related issues, maintaining accuracy across all project phases.
* Identify trends in clinical, operational, and financial data to support informed decision-making.
* Contribute to the development of publishable content related to program data and impact.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree required (Public Health, Statistics, Data Science, or related field).
* Master’s degree in Public Health or a related field preferred.
* Minimum two years of experience working with health-related data and program evaluation.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience with Tableau.
* Familiarity with data management systems and statistical analysis tools.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, with attention to detail.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and meet project deadlines in a remote team environment.

**Benefits**

* Comprehensive medical coverage through multiple Cigna plans (including for remote employees)
* Dental and vision insurance starting the first of the month after hire
* Health Savings Accounts (HSA) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* Generous PTO policy and six paid holidays
* 403(b) retirement plan with employer contributions after two years
* Tuition reimbursement up to $5,250 annually
* Childcare FSA with employer contributions
* Wellness incentives and employee assistance programs
* Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) eligible employer
* Disability and life insurance options
* Access to discounts on services, insurance, and transportation

**Compensation Range:**
$58,656 – $77,572.56
  
  
**Equal Opportunity**
National Jewish Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing a work environment that fosters diversity, equity, and inclusion. We value all applicants and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

title: Cyber Data Analyst
description:
Our client, a leading international bank, is seeking a
**Cyber Data Analyst**
to support its Cyber Resiliency Program. This role will focus on analyzing data from cybersecurity and risk assessments and delivering insights aligned with key regulatory and industry frameworks such as FFIEC, NYDFS, NIST, and PCI.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Analyze complex datasets from cybersecurity and risk assessments to identify trends, threats, and actionable insights.
* Interpret data findings and translate them into practical remediation steps in line with regulatory standards.
* Design, build, and maintain dashboards to visualize cyber threats, vulnerabilities, and risk metrics.
* Collaborate with cybersecurity, risk, and IT teams to enhance data-driven decision-making across the program.
* Support continuous improvement of cyber resilience reporting through automation and analytics.

**Required Skills & Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in data analytics, preferably within cybersecurity or risk domains.
* Proficiency in data visualization tools such as
  **Power BI**
  and experience working with platforms like
  **ServiceNow (SNOW)**
  .
* Solid understanding of cyber and risk assessment methodologies and frameworks (e.g., NIST CSF, FFIEC, NYDFS, PCI DSS).
* Strong analytical, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills.
* Ability to work independently and in cross-functional teams in a dynamic, global environment.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Background in financial services or regulated environments.
* Familiarity with scripting or data manipulation tools (e.g., SQL, Python) is a plus.

title: Data Analyst I - Placement Student
description:
Lensa is a U.S. career site that helps job seekers discover job opportunities. We are not a staffing firm or agency. We promote jobs on behalf of our clients, which include employers, recruitment agencies, and marketing partners.
  
  
**About Prgx**
About PRGX Global, Inc
  
  
We provide the business intelligence to unlock incremental value from data and expand impact across our clients' organizations for healthier whole businesses. PRGX pioneered Recovery Audit nearly 50 years ago and is now the global leader in source-to-pay analytics and margin expansion. PRGX empowers clients in more than 30 countries with the business intelligence to recover $1.2 billion in annual cash flow, unlocking value and improving the overall health of organizations across the world. We collaborate with supplier communities to realize improved profits and deliver the tools to optimize processes, finding immediate and lasting value. With end-to-end technology and deep vertical expertise that underpins our recovery, preventive, and analytics solutions, we provide the actionable insights to minimize leakage, optimize cash flow, and shape stronger, healthier businesses. F or additional information on PRGX, please visit www.prgx.com .
  
  
**Job Description**
Data Analyst I
  
  
**Summary**
Data Analyst I interacts with global, cross-functional teams across the organization. Works with the field audit staff and other DataAnalysts to define and complete client data conversion projects based on requirements of the audit by performing the following duties.
  
  
**Job Duties & Responsibilities**

* Performs analysis tasks that utilize knowledge of business and accounting to direct or develop programming necessary toprovide required audit tools to the audit site.
* Converts client data to PRGX standard formats leveraging parameter driven SQL programming.
* Ensure data integrity by verifying data readability, data structure, data content, data scope, etc. thereby helping to eliminatedata related issues further within the business data flow process.
* Under general supervision responds to requests from the audit staff for data conversion, standard reports, non-standardreports, and related support issues including analysis and programming.
* Assists other team members in evaluating, diagnosing, and correcting business application problems.
* Provides programming support to other staff members on business system design issues, custom applications, andprogramming issues as required.
* Increases knowledge of PRGX applications and expands technical knowledge through trade publications, courses anddemonstrations.
* Expands understanding of PRGX’s business practices, techniques and auditing.
* Contributes to the success of the organization by helping others accomplish job results; learning new skills needed by theteam; improving code reusability; finding new ways to help the team

**Work Experience And Education Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university; or one to three years related experience and/or training; orequivalent combination of education and experience.
* Prefer 1+ years of experience in an office environment, data analysis and/or conversion related.
* MS SQL & T-SQL experience; relational database analysis
* Exposure to/knowledge of JSON formats and object storage platforms a plus
* Exposure to various file formats like delimited, positional & EBCDIC a plus
* Exposure to/knowledge of reporting solutions like Power BI
* Knowledge of basic Python scripting to automate tasks.
* Financial accounting or auditing knowledge; exposure to financial systems (SAP, Oracle, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, etc.)
* Solid analytical and communication skills
* Experience with MS Office products
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-performing team environment

**Skills & Requirements Qualifications**

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Company Overview**
At HubSpot, we aim to help businesses grow better every day. We are pivoting towards a more scaled inbound sales approach leveraging AI in how we route & handle demand to drive efficiency in our sales development team. We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our team, focusing on redefining our inbound sales development paradigm globally.
  
  
**Job Summary**
The Senior Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving operational rigor and strategy development for the inbound sales development team of Inbound Success Coaches (ISC). This role is essential for building a strategy to scale this function for the future through AI & automation, ensuring alignment with our conversational marketing strategy, and fueling pipeline growth. The analysis & insights this individual creates will inform data driven decision making by executive leadership to guide the evolution.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities**

* Define, measure, and communicate the metrics of success and value-added by the ISC organization.
* Master the inbound sales motion and process to become a trusted leader in the specifics of ISC strategy.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, technical teams, product operations, and sales, fostering a united approach.
* Build and maintain deep relationships with sales and marketing partners and be capable of presenting strategies and outcomes to C-suite executives.
* Exhibit autonomy and take ownership of projects; drive influence through innovation without needing step-by-step guidance.
* Develop scalable strategies and practices that can be extended to global teams

**Qualifications**

* A minimum of 4 years of experience in a sales strategy role or equivalent level position.
* Demonstrated expertise in analytical or modeling techniques using tools like Looker, Hex, or Google Suite.
* Strong aptitude for defining key metrics and conducting analyses to derive actionable insights.
* Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with a proven track record of presenting to revenue-driven executives.
* Strong capability to identify personal and professional growth opportunities and willingness to expand beyond baseline responsibilities.
* Proficiency with MS Office Suite, Google Apps, Salesforce.com, and HubSpot CRM.
* Proven SQL knowledge and experience.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous working environment.

**Pay & Benefits**
The cash compensation below includes base salary, on-target commission for employees in eligible roles, and annual bonus targets under HubSpot’s bonus plan for eligible roles. In addition to cash compensation, some roles are eligible to participate in HubSpot’s equity plan to receive restricted stock units (RSUs). Some roles may also be eligible for overtime pay. Individual compensation packages are tailored to your skills, experience, qualifications, and other job-related reasons.
  
  
This resource will help guide how we recommend thinking about the range you see. Learn more about HubSpot’s compensation philosophy.
  
  
Benefits are also an important piece of your total compensation package. Explore the benefits and perks HubSpot offers to help employees grow better.
  
  
At HubSpot, fair compensation practices aren’t just about checking off the box for legal compliance. It’s about living out our value of transparency with our employees, candidates, and community.
  
  
**Annual Cash Compensation Range**
$118,500—$189,600 USD
  
  
*We know the*
*confidence gap*
*and*
*impostor syndrome*
*can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.*
***If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form.***
**At HubSpot, we value both flexibility and connection. Whether you’re a Remote employee or work from the Office, we want you to start your journey here by building strong connections with your team and peers. If you are joining our Engineering team, you will be required to attend a regional HubSpot office for in-person onboarding. If you join our broader Product team, you’ll also attend other in-person events such as your Product Group Summit and other gatherings to continue building on those connections.**

**About HubSpot**
HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  
You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022 and has been recognized for its award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.
  
  
Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees across the globe work remotely and in HubSpot offices. Visit our careers website to learn more about the culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:

title: Network Data Analyst (100% Remote)
description:
Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for ClearCaptions.
  
  
**Who We Are**
Since our founding in 2011, our mission has been to improve the lives of seniors and their caregivers. We are deeply passionate about communication and committed to becoming the foremost provider of services and solutions that enable seniors to lead more meaningful and independent lives. We also understand the power of connection and the profound impact it has on the lives of individuals who are hard-of-hearing. By utilizing enhanced automatic speech recognition, human captioning, and innovative product development, we deliver easy-to-use, cutting-edge technology to our primarily senior customer base. Our near real-time phone captioning technology allows individuals with hearing loss to see what callers are saying, enabling them to regain their connection to the world.
  
  
ClearCaptions is a Federal Communications Commission (FCC)-certified telephone captioning provider, adhering to the highest industry standards of privacy, security, and professionalism. We recognize the importance of maintaining the trust and confidence of our customers, and we continually strive to exceed their expectations.
  
  
For more information about our services please visit clearcaptions.com .
  
  
**Position Summary**
The Network Data Analyst plays a critical role in analyzing and optimizing network performance, identifying service- impacting trends, and proactively detecting network anomalies. This role is responsible for real-time network monitoring, deep data analysis, root cause investigations (RCA), and reporting on performance trends. The analyst will work with large datasets, VoIP/SIP traffic, network latency metrics, system logs, and incident patterns to ensure optimal network stability and service quality.
  
  
This is a Remote/Work from Home position reporting to the Sr. IT Manager
  
  
**What You Will Do**

* Monitor network traffic, VoIP/SIP signaling, latency, jitter, and packet loss to detect anomalies and ensure service reliability.
* Analyze call platform data, dropped call rates, connection failures, and network congestion trends to improve overall service quality.
* Utilize tools like Datadog, Wireshark, Splunk, and Power BI to identify network inefficiencies and recommend optimizations.
* Proactively search for patterns in large datasets, correlating logs and performance metrics to uncover hidden issues.
* Investigate historical network incidents, VoIP/SIP errors, and system downtime logs to detect recurring trends.
* Compile post-incident RCA reports, highlighting key problem areas and recommending corrective actions.
* Work with IT Operations, DevOps, and Network Engineers to troubleshoot service-impacting issues and improve stability.
* Provide data-backed insights into failed connections, call routing problems, and service degradation factors.
* Configure and fine-tune network monitoring alerts to enhance real-time detection of service disruptions.
* Reduce false positives by refining alert thresholds based on real-world performance data.
* Identify new monitoring points by analyzing failure patterns and customer-reported issues.
* Work with AI-driven analytics tools to proactively detect service degradation before it impacts customers.
* Develop real-time dashboards for tracking network latency fluctuations, call connection rates, and system uptime.
* Utilize Power BI, Tableau, or Datadog to create performance trend reports and visual analytics for IT leadership.
* Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership, customer support, and compliance teams.
* Maintain detailed documentation of analysis processes, incident reports, and RCA findings

**The Kind Of People We Look For**

* Versatile people who thrive on variety and challenge
* Excited about working in a fast-paced environment
* Innate problem solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative culture
* Takes initiative, pushes boundaries, motivated to innovate
* Talented individuals with a growth mindset who want to use their learning and relationship-building skills
* Align with our company core values: Integrity, Accountability, Collaboration, Service and Quality

**Qualifications**

* 3+ years of experience in network analysis, data analytics, or IT performance monitoring.
* Strong ability to analyze large datasets, detect trends, and provide actionable insights.
* Experience with SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization tools.
* Ability to interpret network performance data, VoIP call logs, and SIP signaling reports.
* Experience with Datadog, Wireshark, Splunk, Grafana, or other network monitoring tools preferred.
* Knowledge of VoIP, SIP trunking , and telecom infrastructure preferred.
* Exposure to network operations, IT service management, or telecom network analysis.
* Familiarity with ITIL, ITSM, or incident management frameworks preferred.
* Experience working with telecom carriers, VoIP providers, or network engineering teams preferred.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, presentation, and problem-solving skills.
* Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes .
* Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create high -quality results -driven, team-oriented environment.
* D emonstrated ability to use discretion, make sound decisions, and maintain confidentiality.
* Proficient in MS Office, modern communication tools for virtual teams (i.e., MS Teams)

**Physical Demands**
Employees may experience the following physical demands for extended periods of time:
  
  

* Sitting, standing, and walking (95-100%)
* Keyboarding (40-60%)
* Viewing computer monitor, tablet and cell phone screen requiring close vision (95-100%)

**Work Environment**
100% Remote: Work environment is at home.
  
  
**Compensation**
$87,000 - $97,000/yr prospectively with consideration to experience and geographical location . Please see www.clearcaptions.com/careers for an overview of our generous benefits program.
  
  
Intrigued to learn more?
  
  
When you apply for this role, your information will be personally reviewed by our talent acquisition team (not by a robot). You can expect to hear back from us if we think there could be a fit and what next steps look like.
  
  
ClearCaptions is an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusion and diversity. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees to do this job.

title: Data Insights Analyst - Healthcare ( remote ) ( remote )
description:
Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for AssistRx.
  
  
The Data Insight Analyst is responsible for acquiring, managing and analyzing data that will be presented to internal teams, clients and partners. The Data Analyst leads the onboarding of electronic data trading partners and is responsible for the success of trading partner implementations. The Data Quality Analyst is responsible for monitoring client data submissions and communicating with them in the resolution of data quality issues.
  
  
**Requirements**

* Developing reports and analytics using data from data warehouse and Salesforce using Excel, SQL, Tableau, and other reporting/analytics tools.
* Provide consultative insights:
* Analyze data to identify patterns and trends over time.
* Compare data from different categories to identify relationships or correlations.
* Applying statistical analysis to identify patterns and relationships in the data.
* Provide context and explanations for the data by using visualizations and narrative descriptions.
* Identify outliers or anomalies in the data and investigate their causes.
* Review and QA data/report before it is provided to the client (internal/external).
* Communicates directly with customer on data needs and key deadlines.
* Researches and identifies data quality issues.
* Manage ongoing, incoming partner requests and questions regarding data specifications.
* Configures mapping tools to support translation from source data to desired format. Includes testing of tool and providing clear documentation to internal resources and customer.
* Act as resident expert for data requirements/specifications internally and for the client as needed.
* Remain informed and up to speed with ongoing changes and evolution of assigned program data specs.
* Lead client/partner web-based trainings regarding data specifications and requirements.

**Qualifications**

* Self-starter, an individual who is not fully dependent on direction to fulfill the functions of the role.
* Thrives in an entrepreneurial-like environment.
* Experience with Tableau and Salesforce reporting preferred.
* Experience with healthcare and/or pharmacy data preferred.
* Experience with Microsoft Excel and SQL is a must.
* Previous client-facing experience is a must.
* Must be extremely responsive, able to work under pressure in crisis with a strong sense of urgency.

**Benefits**
  
  

* Supportive, progressive, fast-paced environment
* Competitive pay structure
* Matching 401(k) with immediate vesting
* Medical, dental, vision, life, & short-term disability insurance


+ AssistRx, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit based factors, or any other protected categories protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Tableau Analyst - 100% Remote
description:

Job details

**A Bit About Us**
This is a national multi-billion dollar healthcare organizations with an AMAZING culture. This department is responsible for all of the generation, billing, and follow-up of claims for company's patients to their insurance providers. Their mission is to ensure that every claim gets on file timely and accurately. To do so, they've continued to evolve the billing landscape over the years through operations excellence and transformation. As an Analyst on this team, you will join a dynamic, growing team at the center of the revenue cycle, and help them continue to drive operations and strategy through data management, project management, a deep understanding of how challenging our revenue cycle can be, and an eye for the future in helping them continue to transform billing.
  
  
Get ready to take your career to the next level with our exciting opportunity! We are in search of a dynamic and experienced Tableau Developer to join our team on a full-time, permanent basis. This is a 100% remote position, offering you the chance to work from the comfort of your home while making a significant impact in the finance industry.
  
  
****Why join us?****

* Top benefits
* 401K / match
* Strong Bonus
* Great compensation package
* Great time off package
* The best Work life balance
* 100% remote

**Job Details**

As a Tableau Developer, you will be responsible for the following
  
  

* Translating existing recurring reports into innovative and insightful Tableau Dashboard visualizations.
* Developing and designing new Tableau dashboards as requested by revenue operations partners to address key business challenges.
* Meeting with stakeholders to ensure developed dashboards are meeting the business needs and expectations.
* Utilizing your SQL/ETL experience to manage data extraction, transformation, and loading tasks.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop solutions that optimize the use of data and analytics.
* Maintaining and supporting data analytics platforms while ensuring performance, security, and availability.
* Training and supporting end-users to maximize the value of the implemented dashboards and tools.

**Qualifications**
To be considered for this role, you should have
  
  

* A minimum of 5+ years of experience as a Tableau Developer or in a similar role.
* Proficiency in SQL and ETL tools for managing and manipulating data.
* Strong experience in developing, maintaining, and managing Tableau driven dashboards & analytics and working knowledge of Tableau administration/architecture.
* Excellent understanding of the business operations in the finance industry.
* Proven ability to translate business problems into actionable Tableau-driven solutions.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively liaise with stakeholders at all levels.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.

If you are passionate about data visualization, possess a problem-solving attitude, and are ready to drive change within our organization, we would love to hear from you. Apply now and start your journey with us!

description:

The MLS Analyst, Anywhere MLS Integrations is responsible for driving the execution of three-way MLS agreements between outside vendors, Brand Brokers, and various MLSs. The Analyst will ensure that all MLS feeds are in compliance to prevent data loss, as well as manage payments for these feeds. Our diverse brand portfolio includes some of the most recognized names in real estate: Better Homes and Gardens® Real Estate, CENTURY 21®, Coldwell Banker®, Coldwell Banker Commercial®, Corcoran®, ERA®, and Sotheby’s International Realty®.

* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to change gears quickly to support different customers and products
* Able to manage own workflow while coordinating with project teams and management on schedules, requirements, goals, and assignments as needed

* Ability to manage and meet tight deadlines

This position will be remote.

title: Strategic Insights Analyst
description:
**Strategic Insights Analyst (Spirits Vertical)**

**Location:**
Remote

**Industry:**
Beverage Alcohol / Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG)

**Overview:**

We are 3 Tier Beverages – the fastest growing data analytics companies in the Adult Beverage space. Founded in late 2019, 3 Tier Beverages currently provides data solutions to 300+ beer, wine, and spirits partners across the United States and Europe.

We are seeking a highly motivated
**Strategic Insights Analyst to support our rapidly expanding Spirits Consultant Vertical.**
In this collaborative role,
you’ll work closely with internal teams and clients to interpret sales performance, derive category insights, and support business development initiatives. You will report directly to the Spirits Vertical Team. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, is detail-oriented, and possesses strong analytical and communication skills. We will provide you with the opportunity to work with our expanding portfolio of suppliers, distributors, retailers, and partnered organizations.

**Pay:**

* $70k-$75k base salary depending on experience
* Sales commission up to $10k
* Yearly bonus

**Benefits:**

* Healthcare covers 70% of individuals premiums with United Healthcare including dental and vision options
* 401K with Principal with 3% salary match
* 3 weeks of vacation in addition to company yearly break between Christmas and New Year
* Phone and Internet Monthly Allowance

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Data Analysis & Insight Development**

* Analyze point-of-sale (POS) scan data, revenue, and consumer behavior to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
* Develop compelling, insight-driven presentations using NIQ (Nielsen) and VIP data (as well as additional data sources)
* Create and communicate “selling stories” across multiple data sets
* Educate client sales teams on how to interpret and leverage data for decision-making
* Prepare data points for thought leadership content and strategic discussions

**Client Support & Strategic Execution**

* Support client consulting efforts with data dashboards, pricing and promotion analysis, Annual Business Plans, Retailer submissions, and shareholder presentations
* Conduct ad-hoc data pulls using platforms like iDig and Discover/Byzzer (Nielsen)
* Lead or support client training sessions on 3-Tier tools and syndicated data platforms

**New Business Development**

* Create prep materials and market research to support consultants in prospecting and pitch efforts
* Collaborate with consultants to track client/prospect progress in Monday.com (CRM)
* Assist in proposal writing and maintain training documentation

**Internal Projects & Tools**

* Track and report internal KPIs and Nielsen metrics
* Contribute to additional internal solutions such as Depletion Goal Trackers, client coverage maps, and newsletter trend reports

**Qualifications:**

**Required**

* Proficiency in syndicated data tools: NIQ (Nielsen), Circana (IRI)
* VIP iDig and depletion data
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; high attention to detail
* Ability to distill complex data into actionable insights and concise narratives
* Excellent Excel skills (macros, pivot tables, index/match, SUMIFS) and PowerPoint expertise
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to multitask, prioritize effectively, and work independently in a remote environment

**Preferred**

* Experience in sales, marketing, or analytics within the Beverage Alcohol or broader CPG space
* Familiarity with tools such as Consumer Panel, Spectra, Sip Source, Technomic, Numerator, Data Essentials
* Knowledge of spirits categories and trends is a strong plus
* CRM experience (e.g., Monday.com)

**Ideal Candidate Traits**

* Self-starter who proactively engages in professional development and stays informed on industry trends
* Collaborative mindset with a high degree of ownership and accountability
* Strong business acumen and customer-centric perspective

title: Data Analyst
description:
Piper Companies is hiring a Data Analyst for a well known CRO located in the United States. The Data Analyst will be a part of a small, focused research team in a fast-paced programming environment. Successful candidates must be problem solvers, confident in their technical skillset, and comfortable working independently from the start.
**The Data Analyst can work remotely in the United States and is not able to provide sponsorship.**
**Responsibilities for the Data Analyst:**

* Lead the development of statistical programs and conduct analyses using oncology-specific secondary RWD sources, including claims, EHR, and genomic data.
* Support the development of key study documents, including statistical analysis plans, analysis specifications, and study reports.
* Assess the feasibility of RWD sources to characterize patient populations, build cohorts, and define/validate key study variables.
* Plan and program the integration of data from multiple sources.
* Conduct analyses to characterize patient cohorts and perform quality control (QC) on datasets within time, budget, and quality standards.
* Manage and contribute to quality control of programs and automation of data refreshes.
* Communicate timelines, progress reports, and results to project teams and key stakeholders.
* Provide technical, programming, and statistical expertise and independently bring project solutions for complex studies.
* Collaborate closely with epidemiologists and other scientists to refine data management and analytic procedures, code lists, and workflows.

**Requirements for the Data Analyst:**

* Expertise in SAS or R programming and fluency in SQL and macro usage.
* Experience programming oncology-specific methodologies, including deriving lines of therapy and conducting survival analyses.
* Prior programming experience using Flatiron Health data is required.
* Pharmaceutical industry experience is preferred.

**Compensation for the Data Analyst:**

* $160,000 - $180,000 base salary
* Full Comprehensive benefits: Health, Vision, Dental, PTO, Paid Holiday, Sick Leave if Required by Law

title: Data Management Analyst
description:
**Title**
: Data Management Analyst

**Location**
: Remote (EST OR CST ONLY)

**Duration**
: 6 month contract, perm conversion possibility

**Compensation**
: $35/hr to $44/hr.

*Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.*

*Healthcare benefit packages for this role will start on the 1st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, financial protection benefits, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options. 401k retirement account access is offered starting on the 90th day with employer matching after one year of service. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.*

**Required Skills & Experience**

* Expert Microsoft Excel skills with the ability to create complex formulas
* Experience with SQL
* Strong Data Visualization: creating clear and compelling dashboards and visualizations using Power BI (or similar tools) and Microsoft Excel. You know how to tell a story with data, highlight key metrics, and make complex data understandable to non-technical stakeholders
* Experience with data analysis and data alignment

**Job Duties:**

\\* Extract data from multiple databases and systems, apply complex formulas to clean data and perform extensive validation

\\* Map product data across 3 commerce systems leveraging data exports in Microsoft Excel

\\* Load data into Excel workbooks for data activation

\\* Mapping location data from the commerce solution to the financial hierarchy

\\* Join data together from multiple Excel tables

\\* Validate mapping and update inaccurate data mapping

\\* Create new Excel workbooks to drive automation and efficiencies into process workflows

\\* Collaborate on processes with commerce teams, pricing analytics teams, and financial systems on data mapping for unlocking capabilities and enabling systems

\\* Supports initiatives for data integrity and normalization

\\* Track progress and communicate updates

**Nice to Have Skills & Experience**

· Experience with Snowflake

Experience leveraging VBA to create complex excel workbooks to drive automation

**Job Description**

A Fortune 500 client is looking for a Data Analyst/Data Management Specialist to join their team remotely. Will play a critical role in a fast-paced commerce deployment project. This Data Analyst will be part of the Connected Commerce organization and will be accountable for aligning data, creating data visualizations, performing data analysis, and driving insights for the commerce and menu management products within their ecosystem. You will be accountable for aligning data from multiple systems, creating and using complex Excel formulas, and getting data ready for activation within the commerce solutions. This role will require expert Excel skills, an understanding of data tables, data cleansing, manipulation, and creating efficiencies to bring speed to delivery.

title: Data Change Analyst I (Temporary)
description:
**Company Information**
Clinical ink is the global life science company that brings data, technology, and patient science together to unlock clinical discovery. Our deep therapeutic-area expertise, coupled with Direct Data Capture, eCOA, eConsent, telehealth, neurocognitive testing, and digital biomarkers advancement, drive the industry standard for data precision and usher in a new generation of clinical trials. With offices in Philadelphia, PA, Winston Salem, NC, and Iowa City, IA, Clinical ink is rewriting the clinical development experience.
  
  
**Job Description**
Clinical ink is seeking a
***Data Change Analyst I***
to join our Support Operations team based remotely across the United States!
**This is a temporary role for a three month project.**
This individual will support end users by collecting accurate information to confirm and execute data change requests. The ideal candidate will have experience working in a customer-focused IT role and an understanding of basic data structures/databases. The Data Change Analyst I's responsibilities include:
  
  

* Provide service to end users by collecting accurate information to confirm and execute Data Change requests appropriately, and determine the quickest and best method of resolution in the form of tickets
* Create, respond to, manage, and solve Data Change tickets via email, voicemail, phone call or Live Chat within the established timeframes
* Manage users’ expectations in a professional, knowledgeable, and persuasive manner while using good customer service and good clinical practices (GCP)
* Own issues from receipt through closure with an appropriate sense of urgency for exceptional customer service and optimal time to resolution
* Ensure clear and accurate documentation of Data Change request, both internally and externally
* Route required documentation electronically for signature from all required parties.
* Communicate urgent customer situations when further assistance is needed; escalate appropriately, quickly, and effectively both internally and externally
* Assist other Product Support Agents when needed/possible to facilitate timely resolutions to any issues presented
* Collaborate with colleagues and Management to continuously improve and create internal processes to ensure a world-class end-user experience
* Provide input and feedback on departmental “living documentation” in the form of Wiki comments, how-to articles, and other documents
* Work with and as a team, to provide world class support to end users and customers

**Qualifications**

* Associates degree and at least 1 years’ experience in a busy, customer-focused IT support role (or equivalent experience)
* Proven ability to solve problems in a logical, quick, and efficient manner
* Ability to learn a variety of technical topics quickly, including how systems function & the roles they perform from the user perspective
* Effective work prioritization and the ability to work under pressure
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
* Driven customer service ethos
* Knowledge of Windows 7, 8, and 10
* Helpdesk ticketing system(s) experience (such as Salesforce Service, etc.)
* Experience with basic Data structure and databases
* An understanding or hands-on experience with SQL and/or JSON a plus
* Cisco CCNA or Microsoft MCSE a plus

**Additional Information**
Clinical ink is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against otherwise qualified applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, age, sex, marital status, national origin, disability or handicap, or veteran status.
  
  
www.clinicalink.com

title: Analyst 2, Global Reporting & Analytics - FreeWheel
description:
FreeWheel, a Comcast company, provides comprehensive ad platforms for publishers, advertisers, and media buyers. Powered by premium video content, robust data, and advanced technology, we’re making it easier for buyers and sellers to transact across all screens, data types, and sales channels. As a global company, we have offices in nine countries and can insert advertisements around the world.
  
  
**Job Summary**
FreeWheel is looking for an analyst to join our Global Reporting and Analytics team. The Global Reporting and Analytics team acts as strategic partners across the organization by helping stakeholders make fast-paced, data-driven decisions. This role is a vital component for FreeWheel's Marketplace business, which enables the most premium video inventory owners and buyers - such as TV Programmers, MVPDs, major digital media publishers, advertisers, agencies, and DSPs - to drive successful business outcomes at scale. In this role, you will work cross-functionally with internal teams to uncover growth opportunities, identify product enhancements, and develop robust reporting solutions. The successful candidate will require excellent communication and problem-solving skills, and the ability to think strategically while being analytical and detail oriented. The Analyst II will report directly to: Senior Manager, Global Reporting and Analytics. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship. Applicants must be authorized to work for Comcast in the United States without a current or potential future need for sponsorship. Core Responsibilities: Develop and maintain reporting of Digital TV key business metrics using different BI tools for Freewheel constituents, including internal users, external clients, and executives. Conduct regular analysis of large-scale data sets to uncover opportunities to improve overall sales, inventory management, and yield strategies. Prototype and develop automated reporting solutions to monitor the health of the business. Collaborate with business stakeholders and technology leaders to build out new product features and business processes. Ensure data quality and cleanliness for consistent and accurate reporting. Creating ETL processes to accommodate changes in source systems and new business user requirements.
  
  
**Qualifications**
**Job Description**

* Bachelor's degree in quantitative field preferred.
* 1-2 years of experience using data and analysis to drive business outcomes.
* Strong knowledge of SQL.
* Experience with a scripting language (Python or R).
* Experience with Visualization BI tools (Looker and Tableau).
* Advanced Excel Skills.
* Experience in advertising technology is a plus.
* Skilled in synthesizing detailed analysis into clear narratives, facilitating strategic discussions across technical and business stakeholders.

**Employees At All Levels Are Expected To**

* Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
* Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
* Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
* Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
* Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
* Drive results and growth.
* Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
* Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

**Disclaimer:**
This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.
  
  
Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Comcast will consider for employment applicants with arrest or conviction records in accordance with the requirements of applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. Please note that federal state, or local laws and regulations may restrict or prohibit Comcast from hiring individuals convicted of certain crimes. Additionally, an applicant’s criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship on the job duties of this position, which may result in the withdrawal of a conditional offer of employment.
  
  
**Skills**
Business Intelligence (BI); Microsoft Excel; Structured Query Language (SQL); Data Storytelling; Python (Programming Language)
  
  
**Salary**
National Pay Range: $51,392.64 USD-$120,451.50 USD

title: Data Analyst
description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, AaraTechnologies Inc, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!
  
  
Data Analyst
  
  
We are hiring a
**Data Analyst**
with 2 3 years of experience in data reporting, dashboard creation, and analytical support. This role is best suited for someone who enjoys uncovering insights, working with structured data, and collaborating with business units to inform decision-making.
  
  
You will be responsible for building reports, analyzing trends, and ensuring accurate data interpretation using tools such as Excel, SQL, and BI dashboards.
  
  
**Responsibilities:**

* Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns
* Create and maintain dashboards and reports
* Collaborate with business users to define key metrics and reporting needs
* Write complex SQL queries to extract and manipulate data

**Requirements:**

* 2 3 years of experience in a data or reporting analyst role
* Strong hands-on experience with SQL and Excel
* Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) preferred
* Analytical mindset with attention to detail

title: Project Analyst
description:
**Location:**
Fully Remote (Preference for CST or EST time zones)

**Contract Type:**
Contract with potential for conversion or extension based on performance

**Job Overview**

We are seeking a results-driven
**Project Analyst**
to join our team and support executive-level reporting and data visualization initiatives. This role requires a proactive individual with a strong analytical mindset who can translate complex and disparate data into clear, compelling dashboards and reports. The analyst will play a key role in ongoing reporting efforts, project milestone tracking, and implementation scheduling.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Create intuitive, executive-level reports and dashboards that drive clarity and insight.
* Consolidate and maintain complex datasets from various sources, including client data lists, implementation wave schedules, and project milestones.
* Design and manage centralized dashboards to support status reporting and KPI tracking.
* Collaborate closely with internal project teams using
  **SharePoint**
  as the central platform for documentation and tracking.
* Ensure dashboard and reporting solutions remain accurate and updated over time.
* Support deeper-level analysis for project and client tracking as needed.

**Required Skills and Experience**

* **Analytical Curiosity:**
  A curious mindset with the ability to ask the right questions to understand data context and business value.
* **Data Analysis & Synthesis:**
  Strong ability to interpret and synthesize diverse data sources into meaningful insights.
* **Initiative & Innovation:**
  Proactive in transforming concepts into actionable solutions.
* **Collaboration & Communication:**
  Strong interpersonal skills; comfortable working across diverse teams and personalities.
* **Team-Oriented:**
  Works effectively in a team environment and is open to feedback and new ideas.

**Technical Requirements**

* **Mandatory:**
  Experience with
  **SharePoint**
  for collaboration and data tracking.
* **Preferred:**
  Proficiency in
  **Power BI**
  or other BI tools; advanced
  **Excel**
  skills and/or experience with database tools are acceptable alternatives.

title: Senior Data Analyst (P&C Insurance)
description:
***This is a fully remote opportunity***
**Gradient AI:**
Gradient AI is revolutionizing Group Health and P&C insurance with AI-powered solutions that help insurers predict risk more accurately, improve profitability, and automate underwriting and claims. Our SaaS platform taps into one of the industry's largest data lakes—tens of millions of policies and claims—to deliver deep, actionable insights. Trusted by leading carriers, MGAs, TPAs, and self-insured employers, Gradient AI has grown rapidly since our founding in 2018. Backed by $56M in Series C funding, we're scaling fast—and it's an exciting time to join the team.
  
  
**About the Role:**
We're looking for a curious, business-minded Senior Analyst to drive insights that power our P&C insurance technology solutions. Reporting to the General Manager for P&C, you'll play a critical role in translating complex data into actionable business recommendations that enhance Gradient's underwriting and claims solutions for our clients. You'll bridge technical analysis with strategic thinking—leveraging data analytics expertise to identify opportunities, measure performance, and drive revenue growth. You know how to dig into the numbers, ask the right questions, and clearly communicate what the data means for the business. This is a fully remote opportunity.
  
  
**How you will make an impact:**

* Drive business growth through deep-dive analyses on client performance, market trends, and product effectiveness
* Spearhead data-driven initiatives using advanced SQL to extract insights from large datasets and support strategic decision-making
* Champion analytical excellence by interpreting machine learning model outputs and translating technical findings into business recommendations
* Own key performance metrics and reporting frameworks that measure client outcomes and business impact
* Drive cross-functional collaboration by supporting sales, product, and customer experience teams with data-driven insights
* Build analytical frameworks and automated reporting solutions that scale with business growth
* Lead client intelligence efforts, identifying patterns and opportunities that inform product development and positioning

**Skills needed to succeed:**

* Proven experience with advanced SQL - ability to write complex queries, optimize performance, and work with large datasets
* 7+ years in analytical roles with strong business acumen and ability to connect data insights to business outcomes
* Hands-on familiarity with machine learning concepts and model interpretation (not required to build models)
* Demonstrated success translating technical analysis into strategic recommendations
* Strong curiosity and problem-solving mindset with experience in SaaS or technology environments
* Experience working closely with cross-functional teams to support business objectives
* Insurance industry knowledge, particularly P&C underwriting or claims management, is a plus
* Startup experience and comfort with fast-paced, evolving environments is a plus

**What You Bring:**

* You have a solutions-oriented mindset and sharp critical thinking that drives effective problem-solving.
* You turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that influence business strategy
* You have a proactive nature that leads you to identify and seize new data-driven initiatives
* You have a passion for data and a deep curiosity that drives you to dive in and unlock unlimited insights

**What We Offer:**

* A fun, team-oriented startup culture
* Generous stock options - we all get to own a piece of what we're building
* Unlimited vacation days
* Flexible schedule that supports working from home
* Full benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, paid paternal leave, and more
* Ample opportunities to learn and take on new responsibilities

We are an equal opportunity employer

title: Senior People Analytics Data Analyst (Remote, US)
description:
**About Grafana Labs**
There are more than 950,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a SpaceX launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include two other open-source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs) and Grafana Tempo (for traces).
  
  
**About The Role**
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our recently formed People Analytics team and guide our implementation of data infrastructure and tooling, as well as drive strategy and roadmap prioritization. This role will partner closely with our various People Team functions (e.g., Business Partners, L&D, Workday/Total Rewards, Talent Acquisition, etc.), as well as our Data & Analytics department, and report to our Senior Manager of People Analytics.
  
  
The People Analytics function was launched last year and the team is looking to really ramp up the analytics capabilities of the team, everything from data cleansing/transformation and modeling to data visualization and self-service dashboarding.
  
  
If you are excited about helping build our People Analytics team in our next stage of growth, we'd love to hear from you!
  
  
**You Will**

* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders across the People Team, business and Data & Analytics department to understand analytics needs and translate them into scalable solutions
* Build and maintain scalable, high-quality data pipelines and processes for People Analytics reporting, automations, and ultimately insights
* Develop and manage dbt models to transform and test our people data in partnership with our Analytics Engineering team
* Create and automate clear, actionable, self-service dashboards for the People Team and business leadership
* Serve as a strategic partner and subject matter expert across the People Team and broader business to shape the people analytics roadmap, define KPIs, and guide long-term strategy

**You have**

* Experience partnering across people, business and data/analytics organizations, and familiarity with typical people analytics metrics, KPIs and analysis
* SQL: writing complex yet efficient SQL is a daily habit for you
* Data Visualization: experience with any of the following tools Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, Mode, Hex, or of course, Grafana!
* Experience working with people data from various sources/systems, writing dbt models, and code version control (git)
* Excellent communication skills, able to explain technical topics to non-technical audiences, and maintain many of the essential cross-team and cross-functional relationships necessary for the team’s success

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees.
  
  
We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.
  
  
In the United States, the Base compensation range for this role is $123,933 - $148,719. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.
  
  

* Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process

**About Grafana Labs:**
There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies -- including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay -- manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).
  
  
**Benefits:**
For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.
  
  
**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.
  
  
We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.
  
  
*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.*

title: Forecast Analyst - REMOTE
description:
Lensa is a U.S. career site that helps job seekers discover job opportunities. We are not a staffing firm or agency. We promote jobs on behalf of our clients, which include employers, recruitment agencies, and marketing partners.
  
  
Our work matters. We help people get the medicine they need to feel better and live well. We do not lose sight of that. It fuels our passion and drives every decision we make.
  
  
**Job Posting Title**
Forecast Analyst - REMOTE
  
  
**Job Description**
The Forecast Analyst is responsible for providing financial/data modeling, forecasting, revenue projections, and analysis in support of the Pricing and Analytics team, as well as other functional areas throughout Prime. This position is responsible for participating in the development of new methodologies, reports, and analytical models.
  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Provide analysis and conclusions for moderately complex analytical work
* Forecast claims and membership in support of company and client revenue forecasting
* Perform statistical analyses to validate and support usage of key underwriting factors
* Develop and implement changes to improve accuracy of underwriting and other modeling
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify and define financial requirements and assist with developing solutions to achieve objectives
* Other duties as assigned

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Math, Economics, or related area of study, or equivalent combination of education and/or relevant work experience; HS diploma or GED is required
* 2 years of experience in financial, insurance, and/or healthcare industries
* Must be eligible to work in the United States without need for work visa or residency sponsorship

**Additional Qualifications**

* Ability to work independently while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail and meet deadlines
* Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills to senior levels of leadership
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and/or database programming environment
* Demonstrated organization with the ability to balance multiple projects and meet competing deadlines
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to develop partnerships with internal clients

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) or healthcare experience
* Experience using SAS Enterprise Guide, SQL, or other related database programming environments
* Salesforce experience
* Previous work experience with data analysis, large data sets and/or pharmacy claims; creating moderately complex calculations and statements

**Minimum Physical Job Requirements**

* Constantly required to sit, use hands to handle or feel, talk and hear
* Frequently required to reach with hands and arms
* Occasionally required to stand, walk and stoop, kneel, and crouch
* Occasionally required to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus

**Reporting Structure**

* Reports to Manager, Principal or Director in the Pricing & Analytics department

Potential pay for this position ranges from $66,000.00 - $106,000.00 based on experience and skills.

Prime Therapeutics' fast-paced and dynamic work environment is ideal for proactively addressing the constant changes in today's health care industry.
