We expect and require the cooperation of all associates in maintaining an atmosphere free from discrimination and harassment with mutual respect by and for all associates and applicants.

title: Senior Data Engineer, AvaCloud
description:
Applicant Privacy Notice
  
  
Looking to join a world-class blockchain development team? Ava Labs makes it simple to deploy high-performance solutions for Web3, led by innovations on Avalanche. The company was founded by Cornell computer scientists, who partnered with Wall Street veterans and early Web3 leaders to execute a promising vision for redefining the way people build permissionless networks. Ava Labs is redefining the way people create value with Web3. Join us as we empower people to easily and freely digitize all the world’s assets on one open, programmable blockchain platform.
  
  
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join the AvaCloud team. The AvaCloud team is responsible for simplifying the process of launching the next wave of technology enabled businesses that leverage blockchain-native tooling on Avalanche. This includes managed blockchain services, key management solutions, on-chain privacy, as well as Web3 payment infrastructure. This particular role will be an integral part in launching and maintaining web3 applications by ensuring efficient, reliable, and scalable data solutions to our clients, in addition to supporting data management needs for business operations.
  
  
**What You Will Do**

* Design and build robust, scalable & reliable real-time pipelines to ingest various types of blockchain data into cloud-native databases
* Improve AvaCloud product, operations, and business decision-making by growing and optimizing our current data sets.
* Plan for current and future data warehousing requirements and make strategic decisions to create robust and dependable architectures.
* Support a culture of engineering excellence and lead by example
* Create systems to make data accessible via API for the Avalanche Explorer (like Subnet Explorer), AvaCloud Wallet as a Service, AvaCloud portal, and other data intensive applications.
* Support externally facing API and webhook data products that we can expose to AvaCloud clients.
* Help to develop data products that can deliver the next wave of on-chain privacy preserving technologies to business users.

**What You Will Bring**

* Bachelors in Computer Science or related discipline
* 5+ years of hands on data engineering experience
* 3+ years of designing & building cloud-native, high-throughput data processing systems
* Expert in distributed computing
* Proficient with Golang & its native features
* Experience with Data streaming (Kafka or AWS SQS preferred)
* Experience with Postgres database (Aurora or Postgres)
* Experience with NoSQL (DynamoDB preferred)
* Experience with Cloud based Data Warehouses (Snowflake or Redshift preferred)

**Salary Range:**
$158,440 to $198,050
  
  
(
*\\*\\*This is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, a final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience and geographic location.)*
**WHY AVA LABS?**
If you've ever thought about joining an early stage Web3 company - this is it! We're a global, world-class team of experts in computer science, economics, finance, marketing, and law with offices in New York City and Miami. We're highly passionate about Web3 and redefining the way people build and use finance and decentralized applications of all kinds. The company received early-stage funding from Andreessen Horowitz, Initialized Capital, and Polychain Capital, with angel investments from Balaji Srinivasan and Naval Ravikant. Join us and be a pioneer in a new technology that will have implications across a range of verticals such as finance, gaming, investing, collectibles, among many others.
  
  
Ava Labs is committed to diversity in the workplace and we’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not hire on basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state or federal law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

description:

title: Present at tech Events & Earn Weekly!
description:
**About Punch Group**

Punch is a leading AI Research Lab and an innovative agency specializing in AI, software engineering and design. We push boundaries, create cutting-edge solutions and help businesses grow. Our global presence allows us to connect with top decision-makers and drive real impact.

Now, We’re on the lookout for outgoing, Tech-Savvy Brand Ambassadors to represent us in Miami, Austin, Washington D.C., Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, Portland, and New York City. If you love networking, tech, and getting paid to meet new people, this is for you!

What You’ll Do & What’s in it for You?

* Free access to the hottest tech events, conferences, and mixers – on us!
* Tell the world: “Punch is a leading AI research lab.”
* Network with top industry pros, founders, and innovators.
* Pick and choose which events you want to attend – weekday evenings or weekends!.
* Meet people, set up appointments, and get paid! (we’ll handle the rest)
* Help us grow by sharing insights from events with our team to improve outreach strategies.

Why You’ll Love This Job

* Get paid weekly – no waiting around!
* We'll provide the events, you don't have to do any research, you can pick the ones you want to go to.
* Up to $100 reimbursement per event for food, drinks and travel
* Earn commissions on confirmed appointments.
* 10% of new revenue for all closed projects.
* 100% remote & flexible – work on your own time.
* Make valuable connections that grow your career!

Who We’re Looking For

* A natural networker – you love meeting new people.
* Tech-curious – you enjoy learning about startups, AI, and innovation.
* Independent & self-motivated – you know how to make things happen.
* Professional & outgoing – you represent Punch with confidence and enthusiasm.
* Located in one of our target cities and ready to hit the event scene!

Ready to turn networking into a paycheck? Apply now and start getting paid to go to tech events!

title: Sr Customer Data Engineer
description:
At Tailored Brands, We Help People Love The Way They Look And Feel For Their Most Important Moments. Our Technology Team Loves The Way They Feel And Thrive At Work, With
  
  

* Flexible work opportunities, including remote and hybrid options
* Small, empowered teams that have fun delivering real value for our customers
* A culture that values a 50-year legacy while eagerly embracing the future

**Want to be part of this?**
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Sr Customer Data Engineer to join our Tailored Technology team. This individual will be responsible for development and implementation of our Customer Data Platform, ensuring seamless integration with various data sources and enhancing data-driven decision-making capabilities across the organization. This role requires a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
  
  
**What You’ll Do**

* Responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our Customer Data Platform (CDP) to ensure seamless data integration with Snowflake Data warehouse, processing, and analysis. Proficiency to gather and integrate necessary data from Snowflake into a Customer Data Platform (CDP), enabling a deep understanding of customer behavior, preferences, and trends to drive personalized marketing strategies and enhance overall customer engagement.
* Development Initiatives: Manage the design, creation, and implementation of CDP, integrating with Snowflake ensuring the data is accurate, complete, and secure.
* Integration: Ensure seamless integration of the CDP with various data sources ingested within Snowflake, including CRM, marketing automation, and analytics tools. Develop and maintain Snowflake ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) data pipeline processes to integrate data sources / attributes not available within the CDP;
* Create and maintain source-to-target mappings and data lineage; Closely work with data analyst, data scientists, and business partners to build data solutions including writing complex query and query optimization which will support a variety of predictive and reporting applications.
* Data Architecture: Knowledge of scalable and efficient CDP data architectures to support the organization's data strategy.
* Performance Enhancement: Regularly monitor and optimize the performance of the CDP.
* Team Collaboration: Partner with marketing, sales, analytics, and IT teams to comprehend data requirements and provide solutions that align with business objectives. Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation of the CDP architecture, processes, and procedures.
* Ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency across all customer data sources. Implement and provide support to data governance and compliance protocols, including GDPR and CCPA.
* Monitor and troubleshoot the CDP to ensure optimal performance and resolve any issues promptly.
* Machine Learning Implementation: Create and deploy machine learning models for customer segmentation, personalization, and predictive analytics.
* Industry Awareness: Keep abreast of the latest trends, tools, and technologies in customer data platforms and data analytics.

**What You’ll Bring**

* 8+ years’ experience with specific CDP platforms like High Touch, Simon Data, Segment or Similar CDP Platforms.
* Experience of Snowflake Data Warehouse for setting up Data Pipelines.
* Relevant Experience: Demonstrated experience as a Developer in a similar role within the retail or apparel industry.
* Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau & Micro Strategy.
* Experience with API integrations and web services along with data cleansing.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python
* Experience in SQL and writing sophisticated queries (Oracle, Snowflake etc.)
* Experience with cloud-based data storage like AWS & GCP.
* Good knowledge of production deployment, CI/CD orchestration and automation (Ansible, Kubernetes, Jenkins) and Git-Hub
* Knowledge of CRM systems and marketing automation tools like Salesforce.
* Familiarity with agile development methodologies.
* Knowledge of Data Privacy and Security Standards like CCPA, CRPA & GDPR
* Strong understanding of database modeling and database technologies (SQL & NoSQL).
* Knowledge of machine learning and data analytics.
* Certification in relevant technologies or methodologies.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

If you see yourself in this role, but fall short in any areas above, apply anyway! We love to invest in our team members!
  
  
***The Best Kept Secret in Retail***
**Tailored Brands**
is North America’s leading specialty retailer of menswear, famous for world-class customer service and unique offerings like tailoring and custom suits. We are best known by our brands, including Men’s Wearhouse, Jos. A. Bank, K&G Fashion Superstore, and Moores Clothing for Men in Canada.
  
  
We are emerging from the pandemic with incredible momentum. We own a unique and special market segment experiencing record-level demand. This has inspired our 3-year journey to become Legendary; an exciting strategy that leans heavily upon a strong technology foundation.
  
  
With over 1,000 stores across the US and Canada, 15,000 employees, and over 35 million customers, we’re the perfect size! Large enough to demand leading-edge enterprise-worthy technology, but small enough to move quickly and empower our teams with significant scope & autonomy.
  
  
***Apply now to power your career journey to Legendary!***
**Benefits**
This role is eligible for healthcare including medical, dental and vision, retirement savings (401k with a company match), income protection programs such as life, accident and disability insurance, paid time off for sick leave, vacation, bereavement, jury duty, and holidays, wellbeing program, commuter, adoption assistance, education assistance, legal services, and employee merchandise discounts. For more detailed information go to mytbtotalrewards.com.
  
  
**Work-Life Balance**
**Responsibilities**
We understand the demands of work, school, family, and personal responsibilities. Through our work-life resources and programs we offer services for every stage of life to help you manage the day-to-day needs. We offer programs such as:
  
  

* Meeting-Free Fridays (encouraged) | so you can catch up on work and self-development

* Summer Fridays | from Memorial Day to Labor Day so you can enjoy a head-start to the weekend

* Holiday Early Departure | close out early the business day before a company observed holiday

This salary range is specific to Colorado, New York, California, and Washington. The starting salary for this position is $133,494 – $177,944 and may increase to $222,393 depending on merit, length of service with the Company, and other factors. We take into consideration an individual’s skills, background, and experience in determining final salary. Base pay information is based on market location and may be subject to prevailing wage laws, if applicable.
  
  
**Work Environment, Physical & Mental Demands**

* Ability to sit and work at a computer keyboard for extended periods of time
* Ability to stoop, kneel, bend at the waist, and reach daily
* Able to lift and move up to 25 pounds occasionally
* Must utilize visual acuity, speech and hearing, hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer and office equipment
* Hours regularly 40 hours per week, as work dictates, near our Dublin, CA location.

Note: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or qualifications associated with this job.

title: Senior Analyst/Econometrician
description:
**Who We Are**
Tria Federal (Tria) is the premier middle-market IT and Advisory services provider delivering digital transformation solutions to Civilian, Defense, and Intelligence agencies across the federal sector. With a future-forward vision and a mission rooted in service, we bridge capability gaps to help government agencies work faster, grow smarter, and stay nimble in the face of change. Wherever our customers are in their modernization journey, we are the trusted navigator in the path to possible.
  
  
Tria Federal (Tria) is looking for a Senior Analyst/Econometrician to join our team of dynamic healthcare consulting professionals. Our consultants play a critical role in the continued long-term growth of the company and spend a significant amount of time interacting with clients, coordinating and leading project team members and developing and contributing to work products and contract deliverables. We are looking for candidates who possess a tendency towards action, have innovative ideas and the ability to anticipate a client’s needs to achieve extraordinary results. The successful candidate will serve as a subject matter expert for the modeling team, supporting client projects, and will be in charge of programming and statistical analysis, data specifications, technical design, data management, and results reporting for several simultaneous research projects. This person will utilize a variety of technical tools and software to maintain and develop statistical and econometric models, monitoring metrics, and manipulate, transform and analyze data.
  
  
**Basic Requirements**

* Master’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering, or related technical discipline with at least 8 years of relevant experience; or
* PhD in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering, or a related technical discipline with at least 5 years of relevant experience.
* Proficient in linear and non-linear regression modeling; stratified random sampling; constrained optimization
* Proficient in SAS; SAS certification preferred
* Knowledge and a working understanding of business processes and/or operations within the healthcare industry (commercial or federal).
* Demonstrated ability to succeed in a dynamic environment and produce deliverables in tight time frames.
* Excellent oral, written and interpersonal skills.
* Microsoft Office mastery (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

**Additional Qualifications**

* Successful experience creating professional, executive level products using Microsoft tools.
* Successful experience with professional virtual presentations.
* Successful experience in directly supporting healthcare leaders accomplish their strategic and professional goals

**Responsibilities**

* Data management and analysis tasks across multiple projects for internal and external customers.
* Extract, transform, load, and clean medical claims and revenue data.
* Maintain and enhance modeling applications written in SAS that predict revenue collection performance, referral/claim/prescription/call center demand, and medical care pricing.
* Participate in systems development projects (such as corporate data warehouses) through systems and data analysis, application development, system testing and debugging, as needed.
* Provide statistical expertise using traditional and up-to-date methodologies, as well as conduct literature reviews to research methods, adapt and utilize methods for specific projects.
* Supports all aspects of the project, including work plan development, project design, developing software programs, data problem identification and resolution and results reporting.
* Independently document project tasks and specifications. Responsible for managing project work according to work plan, and for successful completion of project goals within project timeline using effective time-management skills. Identify and recommend alternative data/methods to meet project needs in most efficient way.
* Attend and actively participate in staff, data/operations, and meetings for multiple projects.
* Use good judgment and practice in working with highly confidential information. Follow all applicable privacy and confidentiality procedures in daily work.
* Depending on the nature of the project, may work with a project team that includes many levels of staff, or may work independently.
* Ability to assess a client’s organization, strategic goals, governance structure and overall environment to facilitate delivery as well as contract renewals, expansion and new business opportunities.
* Evaluate evolving market trends to identify impact to client business operations and shares knowledge both internally and externally, as appropriate.
* Actively lead project teams, providing strong leadership and feedback regarding work products, client needs and internal deliverables.
* Inform leadership and the client of project status.
* Manage client relationships, including, communications, risk mitigation, stakeholder management and strategic development.
* Oversee project resources and identify and bridge any resource gaps.
* Deliver effective internal and external presentations and skillfully facilitate client and internal meetings.
* Ability to meet internal and external deadlines by efficiently managing time, prioritizing tasks and utilizing available resources.

**Why Tria?**
What defines the Tria brand is more than just our dedication to excellence in our craft; it’s our incredible team of dedicated, talented, and passionate people that make Tria so exceptional. As people powering possible, we are all partners in our team’s shared success.
  
  
As a company that cares about people, we seek to cultivate a culture in which all can thrive personally
*and*
professionally. We offer a top-tier benefits package to invest in your physical, mental, and financial health and wellness so that you can be your best self - at work
*and*
in life. At Tria, we are growth-minded, entrepreneurial in spirit, and committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and opportunity for all. Whatever your background, your role, your department, or stage in your professional journey, here you will have opportunities to learn new skills, seize new challenges, and advance your career as we grow.
  
  
**California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)**
We are committed to protecting your privacy. As part of our compliance with the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), we want to inform you about how we collect, use, and protect your personal information during the job application process. For more details, please review https://www.oag.ca.gov/privacy/ccpa.

title: Data Scientist-Sr Consultant II
description:
National General is a part of The Allstate Corporation, which means we have the same innovative drive that keeps us a step ahead of our customers’ evolving needs. We offer home, auto and accident and health insurance, as well as other specialty niche insurance products, through a large network of independent insurance agents, as well as directly to consumers.
  
  
**Job Description**
This role is responsible for leading the use of data to make decisions. This includes: the development and management of new machine learning predictive modeling algorithms, the coding/development of tools that use machine learning/predictive modeling to make business decisions, searching for and integrating new data (both internal and external) that improves our modeling and machine learning results (and ultimately our decisions), and discovery of solutions to business problems that can be solved through the use of machine learning/predictive modeling. This role will also manage projects of medium complexity. The role will begin to provide some mentoring and development support to help develop new data scientists.
  
  
**Responsibilities**
Utilizes effective project planning techniques to break down moderately complex and occasionally complex machine learning and/or development projects into tasks and ensure deadlines are kept
  
  

* Applies best practices in statistical modeling, machine learning, deep learning, and NLP to develop predictive models that solve business problems
* Identifies and uses programming languages and tools (such as Python, R, SQL, and Linux) that bring efficiency and innovation to the team
* Collaborates across teams to build and implement predictive models that improve decision-making
* Reviews and communicates modeling results to teams, stakeholders, and leadership in a clear and actionable way
* Begins to mentor and support junior data scientists in both technical and business-facing skill development
* Stays current with industry trends and contributes new ideas for data sourcing, model innovation, and business impact
* Experience or understanding of insurance industry data and use cases is a strong plus

Preferred Qualifications:
  
  

* Master’s Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field
* 3+ years of relevant experience
* Hands-on experience with Python, R, SQL, and working in Linux environments
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS) is a plus
* Strong background in NLP and deep learning
* Prior exposure to the insurance industry or other regulated domains is preferred

Supervisory Responsibilities
  
  

* This job does not have supervisory duties.

Education & Experience (in lieu)
  
  

* In lieu of the above education requirements, an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

**Compensation**
National General Holdings Corp., a member of the Allstate family of companies, is headquartered in New York City. National General traces its roots to 1939, has a financial strength rating of A– (excellent) from A.M. Best, and provides personal and commercial automobile, homeowners, umbrella, recreational vehicle, motorcycle, supplemental health, and other niche insurance products. We are a specialty personal lines insurance holding company. Through our subsidiaries, we provide a variety of insurance products, including personal and commercial automobile, homeowners, umbrella, recreational vehicle, supplemental health, lender-placed and other niche insurance products.
  
  
**Companies & Partners**
Direct General Auto & Life, Personal Express Insurance, Century-National Insurance, ABC Insurance Agencies, NatGen Preferred, NatGen Premier, Seattle Specialty, National General Lender Services, ARS, RAC Insurance Partners, Mountain Valley Indemnity, New Jersey Skylands, Adirondack Insurance Exchange, VelaPoint, Quotit, HealthCompare, AHCP, NHIC, Healthcare Solutions Team, North Star Marketing, Euro Accident.
  
  
**Benefits**
National General Holdings Corp. is an Equal Opportunity (EO) employer – Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of any characteristic protected by law. Candidates must possess authorization to work in the United States, as it is not our practice to sponsor individuals for work visas. In the event you need assistance or accommodation in completing your online application, please contact NGIC main office by phone at (336) 435-2000.

title: Sr. Data Engineer
description:
**Position:**
Sr. Data Engineer
  
  
**Location:**
Remote
  
  
**Company:**
Chamber
  
  
**About Chamber:**
Chamber is revolutionizing cardiovascular care through cutting-edge technology and a collaborative team of dedicated professionals. We’re building solutions that enable cardiologists and care teams to gain a population health view of their patients, with tools that drive better decision-making and improved outcomes for high-risk cardiac populations. Join us in shaping the future of value-based healthcare.
  
  
**Job Overview:**
We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer who is passionate about creating scalable, secure, and efficient data systems. You will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing the data architecture that powers our core products, which provide actionable insights to cardiologists, care teams, and patients. The ideal candidate combines deep technical expertise with an eagerness to collaborate and innovate within a fast-paced, early-stage health tech environment.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL pipelines and data models to support our analytics and product needs.
* Develop robust data integration workflows, enabling seamless data exchange between internal systems and external data sources.
* Optimize and scale cloud-hosted databases and data infrastructure to handle complex healthcare datasets efficiently.
* Ensure data security and compliance with healthcare industry standards (e.g., HIPAA, HITRUST).
* Collaborate with product, engineering, and clinical teams to define and implement data requirements.
* Create documentation and implement monitoring solutions to ensure data reliability and transparency.

**Required Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of experience as a data engineer or similar role.
* Strong expertise in SQL and Python.
* Hands-on experience with modern data warehousing technologies (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
* Proficient in data pipeline and workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect, Dagster).
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS (preferred), GCP, or Azure.
* Solid understanding of data security principles and familiarity with healthcare data compliance requirements.
* Demonstrated ability to work with messy, complex data and transform it into actionable insights.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.

**Preferred Experience:**

* Experience with DBT for data transformation and modeling.
* Familiarity with lightweight, cloud-hosted secure data transfer solutions such as SFTPGo.
* Exposure to healthcare interoperability standards such as FHIR and HL7 event formats.

**Nice to Have:**

* Familiarity with claims data sharing formats (e.g., 837, 834, CCLF) and modeling clinical quality measures (e.g., CQL).
* Experience working with or knowledge of the Tuva Project.
* Understanding of common clinical quality measure definitions and rules engine logic.
* Prior experience in a health tech or value-based care environment.

**Why Chamber?**

* Mission-Driven Work: Contribute to impactful solutions that improve cardiovascular care for patients nationwide.
* Collaborative Team: Work alongside talented professionals who are passionate about technology and healthcare.
* Growth Opportunity: Be a key player in an early-stage company, with significant opportunities for personal and professional growth.
* Remote Flexibility: Work from wherever you’re most productive.

If you’re excited about building data systems that make a real difference in healthcare, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and join us in transforming cardiovascular care.

title: Associate Software Developer
description:
**Every developer has a tab open on Stack Overflow.**
We are one of the most popular websites in the world - a community-based space focused on increasing productivity, decreasing cycle times, accelerating time to market, and protecting institutional knowledge.
  
  
Innovation is at the heart of everything we do. We embrace collaboration, transparency, and believe in leading with empathy; creating an environment where every Stacker knows they belong. We embrace that the unique contributions and points of view of all Stackers contribute to our success.
  
  
We are a
**Best Company to Work For**
, in addition to being recognized for Best Company Leadership, Best Company Happiness, Best Company Perks and Benefits, Best Company Work-Life Balance, Best Company Compensation, and Best Company Outlook.
  
  
We are a remote-first company with Hiring HUBs based in the US, Canada, UK, and Germany.
  
  
We’re looking for an Associate Software Developer to join one of our cross-disciplinary product teams. You’ll be working alongside experienced developers, designers, and product managers as you grow your skills and contribute to meaningful features. This is a great opportunity if you have 0 - 2 years of experience and want to learn while making an impact.
  
  
Recent projects we’ve worked on include:
  
  

* OverflowAI experience which includes: Enhanced Search, TIDE IDE Extension for VS Code, as well as Slack/MS Teams integrations with options for auto-answer.
* Improved Subject Matter Expert identification and assignment where users are automatically recognized for their contributions to topics within their teams. This empowers our users to drive more content creation and engagement to their coworkers.
* Scalably deployed new machine learning search functionality into our SOE customers for improved search relevance.

**Skills & Requirements**
**What You’ll Do**

* Collaborate with teammates to build features across the stack: front end, back end, and everything in between.
* Work with technologies like C#, ASP.NET, and SQL Server, plus tools like Redis, TypeScript, and Elasticsearch (don’t worry if you’re new to these - we’ll help you ramp up).
* Contribute to a supportive team environment where your growth is a priority.
* Participate in code reviews, planning sessions, and online discussions (Slack, JIRA, GitHub).

**What We’re Looking For**

* Enthusiasm for learning new technologies, making an impact, contributing fresh perspectives and collaborating with others.
* Around 1–3 years of experience in full-stack development, including:

+ A modern programming language (not necessarily C#).
+ Experience with web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and a relational database.

* Ability to communicate clearly, especially in a remote team setting.

**Nice-to-Haves (But Not Required)**

* Experience working remotely or with distributed teams.
* Any personal or open-source projects that show your interest in building great software.
* Familiarity with Stack Overflow or our blog, podcasts, or tools.

**What you’ll get in return:**

* Competitive Base Salary
* Generous paid vacation
* Generous parental leave (16 weeks at 100% pay), family care leave, and unlimited sick days
* Equity for all employees at all levels
* Industry-leading health benefits that are applicable per country of residence for all our full-time employees
* Company-paid Life Insurance
* Home Internet stipend
* Professional allocation for your growth and development
* One-time allowance to assist with your home office setup
* Company-paid access to Calm, Bravely, LinkedIn Learning, MyAcademy and Overdrive

Stack Overflow is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We value diversity, inclusion, equity and belonging and these pillars are at the heart of how we work together here at Stack. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
  
  
For individuals based in California, and other locations where required, we will consider employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Oracle Apex Developer
description:
Top 3 Skills:

Application Design and Analysis

Oracle APEX

Oracle PL/SQL

Preferred Candidates with State Experience only

The MaineIT DAFS Applications team is charged with upgrading and providing operational support to the Application Inventory System (AIS) and the IT Budget Application (ITBA). The State of Maine staff currently assigned to the AIS project will be transitioned to the ITBA project in the next several months. However, there will still be work required on the AIS as part of ongoing maintenance and enhancements for the Application Rationalization program, which will require a programming resource.

The ITBA needs to be updated to the Oracle Apex environment and requires the full development team to complete the work before the start of the next budget cycle. The DAFS Application team is responsible for this work leaving the AIS work to this contracted resource

The ideal candidate will be a team player, be able to create and troubleshoot Oracle APEX pages, write and troubleshoot Oracle PL/SQL code, be experienced in obtaining and documenting user requirements and creating test plans.

Proven track record of hands-on technical design and code work within large complex systems.

Proven hands-on technical work with a variety of technologies.

Demonstrated technical expertise integrating a variety of diverse technical environments and cross-platform

technologies.

Proven experience mentoring and performing supervisory functions for technical teams.

Ability to make best practice recommendations based on past work.

Proven ability to present complex technical constructs to business and non-technical users.

Proven ability to collaborate with business users, project managers and technical architects

Converts scientific, engineering, and other technical problem formulations to formats that can be processed

by computer.

Resolves symbolic formulations, prepares flowcharts and block diagrams, and encodes resultant equations

for processing by applying extensive knowledge of branch of science, engineering, or advanced

mathematics, such as differential equations or numerical analysis, and understanding of capabilities and

limitations of computer.

This is a professional level non-supervisory position which may require coordination of programming

activities being conducted by the team

Confers with other business and technical personnel to resolve problems of intent, inaccuracy, or feasibility

of computer processing.

Works with necessary personnel to determine if modifications are necessary with interested personnel to

determine necessity for modifications or enhancements.

Leverages excellent written and verbal communication skills to develop new business process and

programming solutions as directed by business and technical stakeholders.

May coordinate activities of computer programmers.

title: Software Engineer, New Grad & Junior
description:
At Jobright, we help high-growth startups hire top talent for their key roles.

About Us

[Jobright.ai](http://jobright.ai/) is an AI-driven job search assistant built to help professionals land their dream roles faster. Backed by a team of ex-Google, Twitter, and Microsoft engineers, and featured in the OpenAI GPT Store, we empower thousands of users daily through automation, resume tailoring, and insider job insights.

What You'll Do

As a new grad software engineer, you'll join our small but high-performing engineering team to build and scale the core infrastructure that powers our AI products. You'll work closely with senior engineers and the founding team on projects that ship fast and make a real impact.

You'll:

* Build backend services and APIs for data ingestion, job matching, and user automation
* Write Python code to process large-scale datasets (MongoDB, Snowflake, Zilliz)
* Develop tools that automate and optimize workflows for job seekers
* Collaborate on cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure) and CI/CD workflows
* Analyze product usage and improve features based on user feedback and growth data

You Might Be a Good Fit If You…

* Recently graduated with a CS, EE, Math, or related technical degree
* Have solid Python skills and familiarity with SQL
* Are excited about fast-paced startup environments and building from 0→1
* Care deeply about user experience and product impact
* Have some familiarity (or strong interest) in generative AI, cloud infra, or data pipelines
* Bonus: Internship or project experience using MongoDB, Snowflake, or job-related platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, Greenhouse)

Why Join Us

* Work directly with a world-class team on a mission to democratize career success
* Own meaningful projects from day one
* Flexible hours, async culture, and remote-first
* Fast growth: Jobright has grown 10x in the past year, with 40k+ daily users and viral reach on platforms like LinkedIn

title: Technical Business Analyst
description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!
  
  
Job details
  
  
**Remote - Technical Business Analyst with Software Engineering Background - Up to $175k!!**
This Jobot Job is hosted by Lisa Maloney
  
  
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.
  
  
Salary $150,000 - $175,000 per year
  
  
**A Bit About Us**
We are a fast-growing software company that is revolutionizing the way people are buying and selling! We are profitable and have doubled revenue every year since inception. Our team has an amazing culture with a positive can-do attitude and are looking for someone with a similar mentality to join us 100% remotely.
  
  
****Why join us?****
We offer the following benefits
  
  

* Competitive base salary and potential bonuses
* Comprehensive benefits package with PTO, 401k with 4% match, medical/dental/vision, etc.
* 100% remote work schedule with flexible first shift hours
* A growing engineering team with strong engineers that enjoy what they do
* Accelerated career growth

**Job Details**
We are seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Technical Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. This is a unique opportunity to work in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment and contribute to the development and growth of our business. The successful candidate will be an integral part of our team, working closely with our technical and business teams to understand their needs and translate them into functional and non-functional requirements. This role requires a deep understanding of .developing and supporting software applications, experience uncovering and writing detailed technical requirements, Axure Wireframing, and questioning stakeholders to uncover objectives, requirements, and edge cases.
  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with business and IT teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Perform data analysis to support business decision-making, using tools such as SQL, Excel, and other data visualization tools.
* Use Axure Wireframing to create interactive prototypes and wireframes that accurately represent user interface layout and design.
* Develop detailed software documentation that clearly communicates software design and functionality to developers and stakeholders.
* Facilitate communication between the business and technical teams to ensure that requirements are understood and met.
* Conduct regular reviews of systems and processes, identifying areas for improvement and implementing changes where necessary.
* Participate in the planning, development, and rollout of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.
* Provide technical support and guidance to other members of the team, helping to resolve issues and improve processes.

**Qualifications**

* 3+ years' experience in a Technical Business Analyst role or similar.
* 2+ years' of experience developing software applications and supporting in a production environment.
* Proven experience in gathering and defining business and technical requirements through questioning stakeholders.
* Excellent data analysis skills, with the ability to use data to drive decision making.
* Strong experience in creating wireframes, prototypes, and interactive user interfaces.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically and analytically.
* Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines.
* A proactive and self-motivated approach, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.
  
  
Jobot is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide an inclusive work environment that celebrates diversity and all qualified candidates receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
  
  
Sometimes Jobot is required to perform background checks with your authorization. Jobot will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with any applicable federal, state, or local law regarding criminal backgrounds, including but not limited to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring and the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
  
  
**Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?**
Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

title: Sr BI Developer
description:
**Summary**
The Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Developer is a member of the Xpanse IMS Data team, working collaboratively with end users to develop reports using enterprise BI systems and provide accessible information for decision-making. The Senior BI Developer will use data from multiple source systems to solve organizational problems through reports, analysis and data visualizations.
  
  
**Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, deploy and support reports and dashboards within an enterprise reporting environment
* Translate business requirements into sustainable and efficient visualizations and reporting
* Extract data from relational databases (e.g., Postgres) and other data sources (e.g., XML files, JSON data sources, flat files) using efficient and well form SQL queries
* Visually structure the data in a variety of forms conducive to answering business questions through BI dashboards, reports, analytical frameworks
* Closely monitor and check the accuracy and completeness of data
* Perform optimization of reports and dashboards
* Design, update and administer the metadata of the various data marts keeping the descriptions of data consistent and reliable across multiple projects and databases
* Continuously improve the process of updating existing reports and dashboards, with an eye towards efficiency and streamlining
* Interact with business users to identify dashboard strategies, report layouts, and analysis presentations
* Collaborate with ETL, DBA, other report development and business analyst resources
* Provide coaching and mentoring to team members in the areas of technical skills and competencies.
* Comply with all company policies and procedures.
* Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

**Other Job Duties And Responsibilities**
Performs other related duties as assigned.
  
  
**Supervisory Responsibilities**

* This position is an individual contributor.

**Qualifications**
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
  
  

* Deep knowledge of relational data structures, theories, principles and practices.
* Practical experience and skills in data warehousing methodologies and tools
* Proven track record of successfully delivering BI and/or data warehousing projects.
* Demonstrated understanding of modern enterprise architecture with hands-on experience with enterprise business intelligence platforms.
* Advanced proficiency with SQL code and related-RDBMS query tools. Working knowledge of Snowflake is preferred.
* Broad experience with reporting system development

**Education And/or Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related major or equivalent IS/business experience with 5+ years of business experience, preferably with a technical background in BI/Data Warehousing, Reporting, Analytics, etc.
* Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
* Experience with Snowflake
* Experience with mobility of BI applications a plus
* Experience with performance tuning, debugging, issue resolution and performance optimization of reports and dashboards

**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations**

* Certifications in BI systems is a plus

**Work Environment**
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Work is normally performed in a typical interior office work environment which does not subject the employee to any hazardous or unpleasant elements. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
  
  
**Physical Demands**
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
  
  
**Equal Employment Opportunity**
The company is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, religion, national origin, age (40 and over), disability, military status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.
  
  
**Americans With Disabilities Act**
Applicants as well as employees who are or become disabled must be able to satisfactorily perform the essential job functions of the position either with or without reasonable accommodation. Applicants as well as employees are encouraged to meet with Human Resources as the organization shall review reasonable accommodations on a case-by-case basis in accordance with applicable law.
  
  
**Job Responsibilities**
The statements reflect the general duties and responsibilities considered necessary to perform the essential functions of the job and should not be considered as an all-inclusive list of all the work requirements of the position. The company may change the specific job duties with or without prior notice based on the needs of the organization.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**You could be a data scientist anywhere. Why us?**

* Join a pre-IPO startup with capital, traction and runway ($240M funded | 60X revenue growth in 5 years | $2T market size)
* Report directly to our Director of BizOps & Analytics, Qingdi Huang (Ex-Bain)
* Disrupt a massive market and take us to a $10B business in the next few years
* Be immersed in a talent-dense environment and greatly accelerate your career growth

**About The Opportunity**
Jerry is looking for a
**Data scientist**
to join our growing team! We hit a huge milestone in early 2024 by achieving profitability and have ambitious goals for the next few years — scale from 5M to 50M customers and become a $10B business. As a data scientist, you will play a key role in championing data-driven decisions across the company, with a focus on optimizing growth channels such as partnerships, marketing, and automation. Reporting directly to the Director BizOps/Analytics, you will leverage advanced machine learning models to conduct in-depth analyses and extract insights that will shape our growth strategies.
  
  
Jerry is building the first super app to make car ownership affordable and accessible – insurance, buy/sell, registration, loans, safety, repairs, parking, etc – a $2T market in the U.S. We started with insurance in 2019, and since then we’ve launched loan refinancing, driving insights, repair marketplace, car diagnostics, and a GenAI-powered chatbot & voicebot. We have amassed over 5M customers, raised $240MM in funding, scaled our revenue 60X and our team to 225 across 6 countries.
  
  
**How You Will Make An Impact**

* Partner with marketing, product, and business development teams to integrate customer performance insights into user and partner acquisition strategies
* Lead the design, execution, and analysis of A/B experiments on new and existing features, extracting key insights to inform product and business strategies
* Define, understand, and test levers to drive profitable and scalable user acquisition and partnership growth
* Identify opportunities to automate manual processes and optimize operational efficiency

**Preferred Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in a quantitatively or intellectually rigorous discipline
* 1-3 years of management consulting experience from a top firm (McKinsey, Bain, and Boston Consulting Group preferred) OR relevant experience in data science/business analysis
* High level of comfort with SQL or Python

**Who You Are**

* You have a framework for problem solving and live by first principles
* You are comfortable communicating with audiences varying from front-line employees to the company’s C-suite
* You set a very high bar for yourself and for your team, and you are constantly pushing that bar higher in the pursuit of excellence

*While we appreciate your interest and application, only applicants under consideration will be contacted.*
*Jerry.ai is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, reproductive health decisions or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other characteristics protected by applicable local, state or federal laws.*
*Jerry.ai is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at*
*recruiting@jerry.ai*
**About Jerry.ai**
Jerry.ai is America’s first and only super app to radically simplify car ownership. We are redefining how people manage owning a car, one of their most expensive and time-consuming assets.
  
  
Backed by artificial intelligence and machine learning, Jerry.ai simplifies and automates owning and maintaining a car while providing personalized services for all car owners' needs. We spend every day innovating and improving our AI-powered app to provide the best possible experience for our customers. From car insurance and financing to maintenance and safety, Jerry.ai does it all.
  
  
We are the #1 rated and most downloaded app in our category with a 4.7 star rating in the App Store. We have more than 5 million customers — and we’re just getting started.
  
  
Jerry.ai was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $240 million in financing.
  
  
Join our team and work with passionate, curious and egoless people who love solving real-world problems. Help us build a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.

title: Data Product Manager
description:
Finexio is revolutionizing how businesses manage and process payments by integrating digital payment and cash flow solutions into their existing software workflows. Our goal is to eliminate the complexity in B2B payments so finance leaders can focus on "what" to pay—while Finexio's platform handles the "how" and "when."
  
  
As part of our growth, we're seeking a Data Product Manager who will play a pivotal role in bridging business needs with data insights through effective reporting and business intelligence delivery. This role is ideal for someone with strong Power BI expertise, a product mindset, and the ability to translate complex data needs into practical, scalable reporting solutions.
  
  
Role Overview
  
  
The Data Product Manager will focus on enabling data-driven decisions across the organization by owning and evolving our reporting suite. You'll work closely with stakeholders from finance, operations, and product to gather requirements, develop insights, and deliver intuitive, business-critical dashboards. Your main tools will include Power BI (required), Looker (preferred), and SQL, with some exposure to upstream data models and pipelines. You will be instrumental in increasing our data maturity while influencing how internal teams consume and leverage data to drive operational and strategic decisions.
  
  
Key Responsibilities
  
  
Business Intelligence & Reporting (Power BI Focused)
  
  

* Own the development and maintenance of Power BI dashboards, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and performance
* Translate stakeholder requirements into actionable reporting and visualization products
* Partner with engineering and data teams to validate data quality and availability
* Manage reporting deliverables from scoping through launch, with a clear communication cadence

Product Management
  
  

* Serve as the product owner for internal and external data reporting capabilities, defining reporting product roadmaps aligned with business needs
* Conduct user interviews to continuously gather feedback on dashboards and reporting utility
* Prioritize reporting enhancements and bug fixes using product management tools like ClickUp

Cross-functional Collaboration
  
  

* Collaborate with Finance, Account Management, Client Operations, and Product teams to understand KPIs and key reporting requirements
* Advocate for end users by ensuring reporting solutions are actionable and user-friendly
* Collaborate with Data Engineering to improve data models that support reporting functionality

Data Governance & Best Practices
  
  

* Support documentation and standardization of metrics, dimensions, and KPI definitions
* Participate in training and enablement efforts to increase adoption of self-service BI tools
* Help implement scalable data validation and error-checking procedures within reporting workflows

**Requirements**
Preferred Qualifications
  
  

* 3-5 years of experience in a Data Product, BI Analyst, or Data Reporting role, preferably in fintech or SaaS
* Expert-level proficiency in Power BI is required; familiarity with Looker and BigQuery is a plus
* Proficient in SQL and able to write optimized queries for data exploration and dashboard back-ends
* Comfortable working with stakeholders to define business requirements and translate them into BI solutions
* Understanding of modern data stack tools (e.g., dbt, Fivetran, Hightouch) is a plus
* Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
* Familiar with product management practices and remote collaboration tools (ClickUp, Teams, Miro, etc.)

Who You Are
  
  

* A natural collaborator who communicates well with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Detail-oriented and analytical with a passion for creating impactful, clean, and intuitive data visuals
* Motivated to improve internal processes and help scale reporting infrastructure
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment where priorities can shift quickly

Compensation & Location
  
  

* Candidate must currently reside on the East Coast of the United Sates or be willing to relocate to Orlando, FL (preferred)
* Remote flexibility offered depending on candidate experience and fit

**Benefits**
Why You'll Love Working at Finexio:
  
  

* Culture: We are a humble, client-first team that is focused on collaborative data-driven success
* Speed: We move fast, love new ideas and give you the opportunity to push your limits
* Growth: We are expanding rapidly into new markets, launching new services and creating a world-class company

What We Offer:
  
  

* The chance to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
* An environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make a real, measurable impact
* Employee Engagement - Quarterly virtual team building activities and monthly team lunches
* Competitive salary and stock options
* Medical, dental, and vision
* Unlimited Vacation Policy

Compensation - $115k - $145 Base Salary + Equity

title: Sigma Reports Developer
description:

**Sigma Reports Developer**
to join our data and analytics team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining insightful and interactive reports and dashboards using

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Career Renew is recruiting for one of its clients an Infrastructure Engineer - this is a fully remote role and candidates can be based in N/S America.
  
 
  
  

Over the next 10 years, payment and financial services businesses will upgrade the movement of money and financial assets to blockchain-based networks.

  
  

We are on a mission to revolutionize the way people access and transact in the world’s most widely recognized and stable currency, the US Dollar. We believe that financial inclusion should be a right, not a privilege, and that cost-effective, accessible financial services can make a profound impact on people’s lives, especially in regions where traditional banking systems fall short.

  
  

We are building a next-generation payments, asset management, and operations platform that’s purpose-built for the transmission of value on blockchain digital rails. The Company is led by Nick van Eck (prev. at General Catalyst 4+ years) and Drake Evans (ex-lead engineer at Frax Finance, the issuer of the second largest onchain stablecoin).

  
  

**What we’re building**
  

First and foremost, we’re building an engineering organization dedicated to producing the best. We are building a culture where we work as a team, we operate as a unit, and we trust each other to produce the best code and culture we can.

  

Our first product — a fully collateralized, freely tradeable USD stablecoin — will be launched in the year ahead. It’ll be competing directly with the heavyweight stables in the market today but will differentiate materially in terms of its value proposition, resource allocation, and GTM model. The stable’s collateral will be managed by VanEck, one of the world’s largest asset managers and ETF issuers (~$80B AUM).

  
 
  

**Job Overview**
  

We're looking for a skilled Infrastructure Engineer to design and build highly automated, self-service infrastructure that empowers our development team while ensuring scalability and resilience. The ideal candidate will focus on eliminating toil through automation, optimizing our deployment processes, and enhancing our cloud operations.

  
  

**Key Responsibilities**
  

  
* Design and implement self-service infrastructure solutions that enable developer productivity
  
* Create automation tooling to minimize manual tasks and reduce operational overhead
  
* Architect scalable and resilient systems that support our enterprise-grade platform
  
* Optimize CI/CD pipelines for efficient and reliable software delivery
  
* Manage and improve cloud infrastructure operations and costs
  
* Implement infrastructure as code practices using modern tooling
  
* Collaborate with development teams to understand requirements and provide solutions
  
* Monitor system performance and implement improvements
  
* Establish and maintain infrastructure documentation
  

  
  

**Qualifications**
  

  
* 3-5 years of experience in infrastructure engineering, DevOps, or site reliability engineering
  
* Strong knowledge of AWS
  
* Experience with infrastructure as code tools (Pulumi, Terraform, CloudFormation, etc.)
  
* Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines and practices
  
* Familiarity with container orchestration systems like Kubernetes
  
* Strong scripting and automation skills (Python, Bash, etc.)
  
* Experience with monitoring and observability tools
  
* Problem-solving mindset with a focus on automation and efficiency
  

  
  

**Preferred Skills**
  

  
* Experience working in fintech or financial services
  
* Knowledge of security best practices for cloud infrastructure
  
* Experience with database administration and optimization
  
* Familiarity with microservices architectures
  
* Understanding of networking concepts and implementation
  
* Experience managing infrastructure for high-availability systems
